Summary: Needed to get away from my home for a minute.  Move-in was quick with a $20 fee.  Room was clean, smelled nice, and a minimalist's haven.    Pool and Jacuzzi no longer exist and has been converted to a dog yard and picnic area.  Rooms are loud due to freeway running parallel to the building.  Parking can be hell at night.    Has vending machines and ice makers.  No smoking in room but there are ashtrays between room doors.  Plenty of eateries and grocery shopping. AC was great.  Bed was quiet and comfy.  Lighting was excellent.  I just needed to get away and this was perfect for us.  Minus a star because of what it did lack.  Otherwise it's a good place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you, we really do love getting such positive feedback! We’re glad your experience was a good one and hope to see you again real soon.  Lilith #Team6

Rooms are basic, clean  Checkin good and polite Room door had damage on locking plate like some one had broken into the room and never repaired, door did lock Ice machine leaking water and located next to stairs, slipping hazard waiting to happen Stairs dirty and smelled of beer Motel Guests outside at 6am drinking beer Dog poop not cleaned up in parking area, stepped in it In the mornings while having coffee I noticed that a lot of couples leaving motel and did not have baggage, some of the females dressed a little like sex workers?? Summary: It was a fine stay here. It was what I expected from a Motel 6. Checkin was fast and easy. The 2nd floor room was cleaned every day and had a nice large TV with good channel selection. I was surprised they had decent, free wifi. I wasn’t expecting that so that was a bonus. Clientele ranged from sketchy to touristy so it was a nice mix. Never really felt unsafe.   The location is decent. There’s a Tommy’s burger joint in the corner who’s claim to fame is putting chili on their burgers.

Summary Heading: Was A Days Inn  Now its Motel 6
Summary: I'm A Huntington Beach Local with 2 young kids and an Alaskan Husky. We hit some hard times when we lost our Single Family Residence that was on Brookhurst and Adams.. We ended up having to stay in Hotels for a few months until we were able to get back on our feet. SInce both my children go to a local public elementary school, we had to find rooms that were not only Local but also pet friendly. Going through all the  companies like booking.com Hotwire.com etc. to find the best deals.. We stayed at Extended Stay, La Quinta, Days Inn, from Cypress, Buena Park  Anaheim, Irvine, Tustin, Seal Beach. The Motel 6 in Fountain Valley was and still is my motel of choice. You absolutely can not beat the prices. On top of that they don't Gouge you on pet fees.. The rooms were VERY CLEAN
Manager Response: Hi Afton, Thank you for taking time to share your review with us.  We're happy to hear the service was great and you were taken care of by our staff. We hope to see you again soon.   Safe Travels. Lilith V. #Team6

I work in the hospitality industry so based on the price I wasn't expecting much.  I figured the room would be a bit worn but clean. WRONG, when we checked into the room we found a dead roach in living room. Things just got worse from there. Summary Heading: We arived, we slept, we left
Summary: Easy to get location. Got a parking spot up front. Looked like relatively safe place.  The room and the beds were OK.  Surprisingly the bathroom was nice and clean.  The breakfast was below average in my opinion.  The pool is non-existent.  I stayed for one night -  if in the area and nothing else is around I probably would consider to stay there again.

I was turn off when I went to check in.  But to be fair I came during a shift change and I had to wait.  But when the front desk called me over he was very polite and joke with me.  With all of m reviews on hotels i am all for great customer service.  The service there were great.  I can't complaint about that.  The rooms is small but clean.  It's an older building so except a little cracks and dents.  Also the key was kinda weird,  I'm just so used to card doors.  I had a few old friends that I was visiting to hang out and they didn't have a problem parking. Over it was a good stay for the price.

Summary Heading: Average Days Inn but carpet was too dirty
Summary: This is not the first time I stay at Days Inn & Suites Fountain Valley/Huntington Beach.  Every quarter, I have the plan to visit SoCal and always stay here.  On this trip, I experience that the room carpet was extremely dirty.  I cannot walk with bare foot.  I have my kids (age 4 & 6) wore sandal/shoe all the time until their bed time.  Unless the Days Inn owner does something about the carpet, I will not recommend or shall return to stay in this Inn next time I go to SoCal.  I did provide my feedback to the guys at the Reception desk at checkout.  Hopefully, he brings it up to the manager in charge to make a change.

Summary Heading: Very nice room, easy access to freeway, short drive to theme parks.
Summary: Large, clean room (and virtually sound-proof) that was a mini suite, right next to Boomer's mini golf, skating, etc. Easy freeway access, not far from Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm, and the beach. Free breakfast is just cold cereal, toast, oatmeal, danishes, but it beats a poke in the eye with a sharp stick. I'd stay here again.

Loved the room, had separate room with couch.  Paint in room looked new and was very relaxing.  Curtains were beautiful.  A/C unit looked new and worked perfectly.  Not far from the freeway, but we didn't hear any freeway noise.  Was nice and quiet.  Great location for kids with Boomers next door.

Summary Heading: Good stay, except carpet was filthy
Summary: Room was fine, next to freeway, but didn't hear too much noise. Pool was good, breakfast just okay. All was fine, except it is in need of an upgrade, CARPET was FILTHY. HAD TO WASH OFF BLACK FROM FEET. It is in a GREAT location.

The hotel was old and out dated. Scary looking hotel. Nothing like the pictures on the website reviews. I got the room with the jacuzzi and it had a horrible smell of urine and I don't know what's else... But told the front desk about the smell and he addressed the problem ASAP. The room was not the best for the price I played. only reason why I stay is because I purchased it though Expedia with no refunds. So I had to stay. The hotel had a great location and that was the only plus about it close to shopping centers and fun stuff to for the kids next door and the beach is very close. I will not come back to this hotel.

Summary Heading: Lacking basic amenities, amenities that do exist are out of order and room not ready at 415pm
Summary: Took train to OC, and arrived close to 1pm fully aware that although check out is listed as 11am, no guarantee my room would be ready. All I really wanted to do was change into beach wear and have front desk hold my bag. To my surprise front desk agent tells me that rom likely won't be ready until 3:30 pm(3pm is advertised), I then ask well does that mean a late check out since I'm checking in late, and he says he will do a 12pm check out. This place was very comfortable and relaxing, plus very close to the beach too..... I would stay hear again in a heartbeat

Summary Heading: Days Inn & Suites Fountain Valley/Huntington Beach
Summary: Rooms are plain but very clean except for the sofa-sleeper  It had disgusting stains and tears on it.

We had a reasonably nice room, clean, spacious.  I wish hotels would figure out how to cool/heat rooms without forcing inhabitants to lie in a draft from the fan.  Breakfast was skimpy and there was no microwave to try to freshen the pastries.  Coffee was dispensed into tiny foam cups.

Summary Heading: Our stay was very delightful and the staff was awesome
Summary: Our stay there was great! The staff were very friendly and helpful. We'll definitely be going to stay there  again real soon.
Everything is good and reasonable price. 1 thing, room next to freeway 405...so, noisy all the time even night :D
I've never had a hotel experience like this. Why am I suspected for stealing hotel property by virtue of staying there one night?

Went to the smoking section which was at the center of this facility around 11 pm.  Look at the second floor and there was a man with a backpack trying to break into the top rooms. There were cars coming up constantly.  This is basically a drug motel.  Never will bring my family here again.

Summary Heading: Never Staying at Days Inn Again
Summary: I stayed at two different Days Inn within two days. They have hidden charges. I had 6 rooms total. 3 rooms, 2 different nights. I got charged a preauthorization that held money in my account, then the charge for each room, then the $100 deposit for each room. They ended up charging my account almost $1800 for something that should have been a little under 6. This was extremely stressful as I was the Captain of Ragnar and was responsible for all of the expenses. Then to get my money back, I had to get letters sent to my bank to get the preauths dropped even days after we stayed! This chain has a horrible way of doing business and myself and my family will never stay there again.

As I mentioned to you earlier in our conversation, lot of times the delay is with your bank, and the amount to be credited back to your Debit Card was less then $ 300.00 We normally reverse all deposits at the time of check out and it is the bank that normally delays the credit.  Again, thank you so much.  Sincerely,  Bk Lee

Summary: The staff was great, especially during check in.   The breakfast needs work.  You need to add something hot such as the waffles and better selection for the breakfast rolls-pastrys
friendly warm and welcoming staff; room is decent, however, freeway noise deprives you of sound sleep, overall, it's OK but not the best

Breakfast consisted of toast, danish and cereal...not exactly what I would call a breakfast

But, I think you might have made a mistake when you mentioned a $ 400.00 hold or another guest smoking marijuana on the stairway, because we do not hold a deposit for $ 400.00 or allow any disrespect toward any guests or hotel policy. I think that you might have mistaken a different hotel.  Again, thank you so much.  Sincerely,

Summary: The over all of this property is good and it close to the freeway. The down side; the noise of the freeway traffic woke me up and also the door sounds from next door.

Summary Heading: Ok on a budget but not great
Summary: I'm in a wheelchair and have a service dog so of course I always get a handicap room. When I checked in there was no handicap room available and they said I hadn't reserved one. The manager actually asked me if I was sure I reserved one? Really??? . Well I had to take the room as there was no other rooms available in the area. The next morning the same manager called me at 830 AM to say someone steeped in dog poop and I'm the only one with a dog.  This infuriated me as I always pick up after my service dog and informed him of this and told him I saw several other dog droppings around the property.   When I checked out there was a different manager on duty who apologized for this and returned my deposit ( yes there was a $100 deposit when you check in)  although I got my deposit

The employees were very friendly & helpful. The location was conveniently located for our needs while in the area.  The room was clean.  The hotel it's self is old; the rooms are small; the beds are bricks; the furniture is scratched and old.  The rooms open to an outdoor hallway versus an interior secured hallway.
The bed was loke sleeping on rocks! The tours bus that came in were loud and the people that came off were rude.

For the rate I paid, I was able to get a real suite at the Marriott for the same amount and it was 1000 xs better.  I actually only stayed 1 of the 4 nights but checked out at 7:30 am the morning of the 4th night.  I should have been given credit for 1 night but they never gave me a credit.  I will never stay nor recommend this place to anyone.

Building is falling a part. There are cockroaches in bathrooms and in the kitchen area. I kept on finding hair on the bed sheets and wondering if the sheets were washed. Breakfast consist of a toast bread with jam, coffee and Corn Flakes cereal.

The desk clerk when checking in was extremely unprofessional. The room had a exterior noise of running water that kept me unable to sleep! I was very disappointed in the breakfast although I understood it to be continental style the choices were very limited (toast or sweet Danish). The issue with sleeping had a major affect on the outcome of the appointments.
Room was extremely stuffy...no air or ventilation. Breakfast was horrible. Cereal for my kids was stale...coffee taste like hot water. In addition hotel charged $100 deposit on top of room fee

Summary Heading: Not a bad place at all, except for
Summary: There's always an except for. Ours was the bed, quite lumpy but sleepable. Internet was dicey, worked via off air better. Breakfast was a no go. Cereal - bad oranges.

Good: Room clean, HWY noise reasonably contained, facility is decent shape.  Bad: non-responsive staff, breakfast-milk ran out before 8AM and didn't get refilled, elevator light broken and wasn't fixed 2Hr after reported to front desk
Breakfast is terrible. The hotel is beside a highway so it's noise. Most of all, the hotel has not return us the $12 fee for safety box as they said they will return to us.

Summary: The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. The only issue we had was with the poor quality of the mattress.

From my experience staying at other days Inns this location did not rate in quality.  The hotel rooms are next to a busy freeway and are able to hear traffic when sleep is quiet.  The room structure not updated, the furniture is old and thrift store quality.  Bathroom mirror had black spots all over it.  Continental breakfast only served till 930.  I requested  late check out was only given a half hour, the standard is one hour more.

This material is used in sound studio and it is about 3 inches thick. We might be the only hotel to have this material installed in the guest rooms. I'm sure that on your next stay, we will have many changes.  Again, thank you so much.......

I would never recommend this MOTEL to anyone.  I can't even imagine how it could be associated with Wyndham. But I suppose they corner the entire market by owning both high end and dumps like this place.  No internet. Breakfast was a joke that was funny enough to make you sick. The whole facility was outdated and broken down.  This place is literally next to the freeway so good luck trying to get some sleep.  I was hesitant to stay here already but my family was traveling with our softball team.  It was worse than I imagined.  But the kicker was the so called HOLDS they had on my card.  Before check in. They held one nights charge. Upon check in they charged they whole three night stay a 100 HOLD.  The next day the HOLD had posted to my account along with the total for the three
Good property, good parking. The location was perfect, the only issue I had was a number of other guests were yelling at 0650 waking me up.

I believe at that time we had many Chinese tour guests and it seem loud but the tone was the normal Chinese dialogue. Please accept my deepest apology, and again thank you so much.  BK Lee

Summary Heading: Not a hotel I would stay at again
Summary: The hotel staff was wonderful, however for $90 a night I would have expected something nicer. the room smelled musty and like bleach when we walked in. Everything was super outdated and the bed was not comfortable. The only thing that was decent was the bathroom. This is something I would have expected at an Americas Best Value Inn. It's a great location and not too far from the beach but I will definitely be staying at a different hotel next time.

Customer service is not the top priority here. They charge you a $100 deposit that you won't get back for several days and there's not one thing worth $100 in the room. Arrived to find a half-finished roll of toilet paper in the bathroom, dust everywhere, no iron, the bathroom door wouldn't shut, Windows sealed shut and the breakfast which somehow had decent reviews ended up being a bin full of bread, a row of toasters, packets of peanut butter, jelly and butter along with cold cereal and another bin of pastries. It was not a great experience.

For price, room was decent.  Right off the 405, 15 mins to Huntington Beach. All the rooms are super close to the expressway which if you are a light sleeper might not be ideal.  I was able to keep fan on which helped with the noise at night.  Room had small microwave, mini fridge& coffee maker.  The lobby was updated but room felt worn but clean.  Bed was pretty uncomfortable.  No shampoo or conditioner in room when checked in, but bar of soap available.  Breakfast was pretty simple: Danishes, toast, cereal, fruit and a handful of tables to sit at.  Starbucks is within walking distance.  This was fine for our 2 day stay.  Business Center available which I used to print boarding passes.  Had trouble cancelling one of my nights since I booked with Travelocity.  Front desk clerks

The breakfast was only bread,cereal,oatmeal packages,juice,coffee but No milk.I've been to other hotels that offer breakfast and there's eggs,sausage,yogurt and waffles. So this was a little disappointing.  The rooms are out dated and you can hear the 405 freeway all night long. The couch had stains on it I didn't let my child touch it. Other then that the bed was comfortable but the pillows weren't great.
Manager Response: Dear Jessica, Thank you so much for taking time out of your schedule to let us know of your thoughts. Please accept my deepest apology for the issue with you debit card, but it is bank's recommendation not to use a Debit card for the Rental Car service or hotels because of the authorizations and deposits. Unfortunately, Debit is not a credit card but accepted where credit cards are accepted and it is the policy of most hotels (not all) and rental car to post a deposit. If this might have caused any inconvenience to you, again, please accept my deepest apology.  Thank you so much.

Summary: after checking, find out that the vending machine is broken, can't get water. reported it to the  front desk, the guy said " I don't know " go outside to Starbuck to buy your water. I will not recommend any of my friend to stay here anymore.
Manager Response: Dear Sir. Thank you so much and please accept my deepest apology for the vending machine. We did report the issue to the Vending Company and we are awaiting for the replacement machine. Again, please accept my deepest apology.  Thank you so much......

I didn't find the bed comfortable however the room was clean and bathroom nice. The television was small, compared to the size of the table it say on, it felt like the screen could have been bigger. Seriously, Wyndham - you're better then this. When I checked in I then was told to pay for the room and did

I loved the separate living room area w/desk.  A Plus... the windows opened for fresh air - but you can hear car traffic, so for sleeping used the a/c, which was fine.  The bed could use a new mattress , but it was doable.   SO the fun started when I was popping corn in the microwave and the microwave caught fire.  The electrical smell was bad but with the windows and door open it aired out pretty quick.   Now folks here's the thing - this was not fun, but I applaud how Mr. Lee and Carlos (management) handled the whole situation.  In less than an hour they had maintenance replace the microwave and the
