We were close to reasonably priced restaurants. Too close to the 405 but that was to be expected. I had no problems with the updated motel. Anytime your headlights face the door the hotel is older and you need to enjoy the reduced price. Enjoyed the savings.  Sure beats camping..

Summary Heading: Stay at a Motel 6- Cheaper & Better Room
Summary: From the street, nice enough. Room was terrible. Beds and pillows were terrible. Not worth over $100 a night.

I was expecting a standard, overused room.  I was only planning to stay there for a 2 night stay while I looked for something better in the area.  Having a suite style room for a good price was awesome.  It felt more like a home away from home.  I have booked there for the next 4 nights.  If things go as well this trip, I may stay there the entire 3 month period I will be in the area.

No coffee pot in room but desk sent up a new one! Breakfast room could be larger & add more tables. Bus load of foreigners take up all tables, stand in parking areas in large groups & pack elevators. Not courteous & are rude!!!

Saw that several people said they kept deposits double charged for rooms.  That's exactly what happened paid for the room thru Expedia then they charged it again instead of a hold for the deposit like every other hotel they run the deposit to get funds liquid then take days to refund it or make you dispute it thru your bank. That alone was enough to never stay there again, also it's old breakfast is non exsistant.  Staff seemed nice but they point blank lie about charges .. I will never stay there again motel 6 is a much better option if you need a cheaper room ..
Manager Response: Dear Sir, Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to let us know of your concern about double charge. There are 2 different types of reservations through Expedia. First is to pre-paid reservation and second is to pay at the hotel. Because the reservation is made through Expedia and the credit card information is given does not mean that the room is pre-paid, and most likely you might have checked the box to pay at the hotel option by mistake. When the guest checks into the hotel, there are many confirmations to double check if the rooms are per-paid or not and I'll be happy to go over your reservation status together. Regarding the deposit, at the time of check in, we inform all debit card guests that the deposit will be charged and reverse back at the checkout. And from our experience with most banks, we found that Charge reversal is much faster than Authorization release (pending hold release). But this depends with your bank's policy.  I hope this reply helped you with some of your concerns, and again, thank you so much for your time.

Summary: This place is over priced at $100. Free breakfast is garbage. Ice machine didn't work vending machine didn't work. Rooms were small average but not for the price. If you like highway noise this is for you as you are in the 405. Stay else ware. I never write my opinion. Lo
Manager Response: Dear Sir. Thank you so much for your feed back and please accept my apology that your stay was not acceptable.  I am very surprise that the ice machine was not working, because we have recently purchased all new ice machines for the hotel, located on both floors, and we have recently upgraded the rooms with space age sound deflecting material that deflects most of the freeway noise.  Again, please accept my deepest apology.

Summary: I was allergic to either a cleaner that was used in the room or the circulation from the AC unit. Had four asthma attacks in one evening. Had to leave the next morning due to medical reasons and we were charge $60 for leaving before the contracted days. Will not be back
saved money by staying a few blocks from Huntington Beach.  Room was clean.  Check in and out was easy.  I passed on the breakfast which was my choice.

Only motel in the area I found in the area that did not have bad ratings for cleanliness and smoke. Room as a bit dated but freshly painted and clean. Not used to paying so much for this type of room but I guess it was based on the area and the time of year.
For the price  I paid and a simple was not good. I paid  the same amount at other locations and got more bang for my buck.

This hotel wasn't the nicest I've stayed in, but not bad for a cheap place near the beach. About a 15 minute drive to Huntington Pier. Facility could use some upgrades, but it was clean and we didn't have any problems. Would recommend if you're just looking for a place to crash for the night.
Everything was good besides the fact that the hotel charged me twice so I was out of over $500 for a few days and they refused to give us a later checkout

Summary Heading: The room and facilities were OK, neither luxury nor crummy...
Summary: The room and facilities were OK, neither luxury nor crummy.  The mattress was old and sagged a little in the middle. The breakfast had coffee, bread, cereal, milk, and oranges, but no eggs or yogurt as some hotels have. Staff were friendly and helpful. The price was lower than other hotels in the area, so we received fair value for what we paid for.

NIce, fairly clean. A much nicer step up from other Days Inn. The outside is also clean, and the pool looks inviting but didn't have the time.  Lack of parking. The number of space doesn't add up to the number of rooms. Had to park in nearby Sports Authority lot.   They actually have an elevator, and it functions smoothly. Handy when bringing luggage up and down.

We stayed there for two nights on our way to Grand Canyon tour and back as this is one of our tour operators pick up/drop off point. This hotel has typical motel design with linear arrangement of rooms on a long open common balcony. View from veranda is towards parking and swimming pool.  The rooms are small with two queen sized bed - suitable for a small family. There are wardrobe, writing table, a small fridge, microwave oven, coffee maker etc. The other side of rooms on the side of windows is highway with fast moving vehicles - the sound of which is sometimes disturbing at night. Toilet is small with bath tub, basin, hot and cold water, standard amenities etc. Cleanliness is good,  linen are fine. Rooms are comfortable. The facility is three storied with a lift. As expected

Lovely decent hotel for the price. Clean and tidy. Basic breakfast but it does say continental. Clean in the diner though. Near Starbucks, burger joint (really good) batting cages and crazy golf all within walking distance. Near freeway and our bedroom overlooked it , but we didn't find it loud. Our room was bigger than expected. Recommend staying here.

This is by far one of the worst hotel experiences I have had. The rooms were old, the toilet barely flushed, and the comforters on the beds were itchy… They promised a hot breakfast and only served toast and cereal. The employees at the front desk or not helpful and They charged me not only for my room but another room twice.
Overall good hotel it was clean service was great we were able to check in an hour early. Our room was next to a the freeway so it was loud at tims.
rooms outdated, pillows lumpy and hard, small beds and space  . Definitely not up to par as a Wyndham property!!

the staff, room, etc. were great. Only problem is we were charged TWICE and we still have an extra $324.82 charged to our card - NOT APPRECIATED. Want that money back.  Pillows are to fat, could not sleep comfortably, ended up with pain in neck and shoulder
Manager Response: Dear Mrs. H, Thank you so much for staying at the hotel, and also thank you for letting us know that the mistake was made by your bank for the double charge. Your apology was appreciated and accepted.  Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Clean. Good for one person or  two if one person is not...
Summary: Clean. Good for one person or  two if one person is not large. No place to hang things(clothes etc.) in the bathroom. No warning re the impending drought.

Summary Heading: one of the worst custumer service ever...
Summary: decide to stay in this place cuz the reviews at AAA (first mistake), we came in during the evening and the outside looks good but when we went to the room was terrible... smells terrible and the bed was TERRIBLE! but we decide to stay (second mistake), the place is for chinnes people and they are loud! I went to sleep and the next day I woke up late (10am) because of the noice I call front desk just to letting them know there I was begine for 30 min and the guys said there it was ok... at 11 am the guy call me and in a not very nice way told to live the place! really??? they kick me out literelly!!! really bad custumer service dont stay here please!!!
Manager Response: Dear Sir. Thank you so much for taking time out of you busy schedule to let us know about you stay. I would like to apologize to you if the Chinese group that stayed at the hotel was bit loud. Please accept my deepest apology. It wasn't because the Chinese group was being rude, but it's the dialogue. It may sound loud but it's just normal tone for the Chinese language. If this was disturbing in any way, again please accept my apology. I will do my best to request to keep the tone down.  thank you so much .

Summary: I travel a lot, and I have stayed at my fair share of hotels. NEVER have I experienced such HORRIBLE customer service and a DISGUSTING hotel. I was promised a fixed price for both nights, and I ended up paying way more for the second night because "that is how our rates are." Regardless, I checked in. Upon checking out, I left my keys in one of the drawers. I knew EXACTLY where I had left them. I was just rushing out of the hotel. I called a few hours later once I noticed my keys were not in my bag. Management claimed they had no keys in their lost and found and said they would talk to the maids the following day. I call back the next day, and they were very short with me, claiming the maids found nothing. It seemed to me that they neglected to even speak to the maids.
Manager Response: Dear Sir, I am so sorry that you lost your keys, but I have checked everywhere and could not find it. I even went to the room that the guest was occupying and together with the guest we searched the room from top to bottom. I had all housekeepers report any lost keys in the room or outside and they also did not find any keys, I searched all lost and find section and did not find any keys. As you mentioned many times that your girlfriend had the keys. Could it be that she might have misplaced it? We have found many items that the guest might forget, from IPhone to Cash and we always return to the proper owner. And if we would have found your keys, we would have notified you. Again, I am so sorry that you lost your keys, but we have searched the room together with the guest, and unfortunately we could not find your keys.  Thank you so much.

Summary: Most uncomfortable place I've ever stayed & ive traveled a lot & stayed at many.   I'm Sure the furniture is the original with mattress so lumpy it was impossible to sleep.   I expected the freeway noise but window didn't seem to have any sound proofing.  The carpet was so filthy the bottom of my feet were black.  I didn't take a chance with breakfast cleanliness. I was staying there while my house was being fumigated for termites & wishing I had stayed with friends.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay after flying all day
Summary: Very friendly staff, clean rooms and a over all good place to stay after flying into LAX.  Need a bigger breakfast area but other than that over all was a good place. Easy access to highway and an awesome place to eat there on the corner. Tommy's Burgers I believe its what it's called. Very very Nice over all. I would recommend to anyone traveling. And this comes from someone in hospitality.

We arrived around 9:00 pm the receptionist was friendly and very helpful.  We stayed for 3 nights.  The bed was made every day.  The room was quiet.  The second night we wanted to use the hot tub.  That area was locked up, we went to check in and  clerk went out right away and unlocked it for us.  The hot tub area was clean as well.

I accidentally got few spot of tattoo ink on the white sheet. Manager told me so I said go ahead too it off my $100 deposit. Thought just around $40-50. It turn out the whole $100. Those sheet are not worth that much sorry.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. N, Thank you so much for taking time out of you busy schedule to let us know of your stay and your concern. In regards to your thoughts, unfortunately, the damage was not the sheets but it was for the bedding, blanket and duvet. Before your departure, and when we were waiting for the AAA to help with you car, the house keeper showed the white duvet with black tattoo ink. I am so sorry if you thought it was just a sheet. Please accept my deepest apology.  Again, thank you so much.

Summary Heading: SO－SO but not much choice in this area
Summary: The location is alright, I expected a lot of walking if I want to take public transportation. It is about 15-20 minutes if you want to take the direct bus to Huntington Beach. If you don't like the breakfast from the hotel, there are starsbuck and grocery store around. I was living alone but I got a very nice room at 3rd floor. The window from my room is right next to the free-way but I guess the sound block is pretty good there because I can't hear any noise. The front desk open 24h but the night shift duty person cannot make any decision because everything I asked, she needed to ask the manager in the morning.

Summary Heading: Good Price - Good Location - Good Stay
Summary: Just a nice place to stay in Fountain Valley, customer service was very good and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel is located next to everything in the Orange County area.

Our room was out dated air conditioning was outdated made noise.coffee pot didn't work.was very noisy around the grounds buses and people from buses! Other family members in other rooms,had up dated rooms,if my family member had not booked this for us I would not have stayed here.and please clean the carpet.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: The door didn't shut very well. The housekeeper came into the room looking for her wallow talkie without asking. The rooms also didn't smell good

The room is relatively clean and in order. I only have some comment about the air-conditioning, the odor is a bit off when first time you turn on try to give service on the air-conditioning regularly, make sure the coffee maker is cleaned properly. maybe add some snack bar so the customers don't have to go out and buy some snacks and foods. cheers
Everything was fine except the TV was awful. It only got a few channels that were clear. The rest were full of snow, and you could hardly make them out.

Stayed here several days while visiting my daughter. First, paying in advance made it impossible to go elsewhere during my visit. We have stayed at other Days Inn motels and have greatly enjoyed them. This one had out dated decor, and the outlets for the coffee maker were broken. We ended up hanging out at the hotel for one day so my daughter could get some down time--she lives with several other girls and loved the quiet time. We were gone for awhile in the morning, got back, housekeeping had not been by yet, which is no big deal for one day. We hung out the do not disturb sign for the rest of the day. They clean their rooms very late compared to other hotels who begin around 9a.m. So, the next morning I made sure to ask that our room be cleaned as we were going to be gone for
the Breakfast was not clean not enough food ,the coffee was good, too many people blocking door and SMOKING  Thanks

This place is horrible! Customer service is not friendly at all. It is in a bad part of town and drug deals go on in the parking lot.  The rooms themselves are not clean. It says the whole hotel is non-smoking but the rooms used to be smoking so if you have asthma, it'll bother you all night. I checked out early because of this and they wouldn't give me a refund and said a manager would call me but never has. When I went to leave, the cleaning people had a cart right up against my rental car and were throwing blankets and sheets from the second floor onto the cart. Of course the blankets and sheets got on the rental car.  This place is a dump. Seriously don't waste your money.
Manager Response: Dear Ms. Traini,  Thank you for your review on you stay. Our staff has spoken to you regarding your stay and you room. I am so sorry but all the rooms at the property are non-smoking rooms.  And when you informed the staff about the smell of smoke in the room, our house keeper and the engineer have examined the room and only smell in the room was from the food you have left. When we did offer the change the room, you refused and request to check out early. This part of town is a very safe and family oriented area, with roller skating rink next door, Boomers arcade, and Sports Authority, as well as Starbucks and few other restaurants. I would say this is one of the safest areas in the city. With our security patrolling the area. I can assure you that this is one of the safest hotel. Also, you were refunded the balance of your stay. I am very surprised to see that you quoted on the review as not being refunded. And reviewing the video of day of check out, I am very sorry, but we could not find and evidence of sheets and blankets onto your rental car.

Summary: It's was cool stay to stay minus all the tourist that showed late and begin to make alot of noise going to there rooms...

Summary Heading: A pleasant stay with excellent customer service
Summary: Before our stay began, we were involved in a car accident. The staff of the hotel were outstanding in meeting our needs in during this time. Also, during this time, new windows were installed in the room making it much quieter.

Summary Heading: A good value for budget traveller!
Summary: I arrived at the property and was greeted very nicely by Omar, he was very helpful throughout my stay. The room which I was given was a suite and adequately furnished and clean with nothing to complain about. Even though the bedroom windows was adjacent to the freeway, surprisingly there was not much noise at all which would affect sleeping. The WiFi signal slightly spotty but good overall. The breakfast had adequate selection for a decent breakfast. Overall a good value for everyday budget traveler.
This is an older motel but clean and the staff was courteous and helpful. The bed was fairly hard so I slept on top of the comforter for a softer sleep. Everything worked well.

Hotel has a fantastic location and service at check in was quick and efficient. The rooms are very outdated and the beds are the most uncomfortable beds I've experienced stateside.They felt like they were 30 years old and the cheapest model available.  In the bathroom there were missing ceiling covers on the ceiling lights exposing all the internals.  Poorly maintained rooms.  I would not recommend this hotel.

room was actually big - two with a sofa liv room area and one bedroom with TV.  little bit heavy on the cleaning smell side probably cause windows aren't really left open to air it out much, I would guess.  good value for a stay over.  plus breakfast in the morning.

older motel situated off one of the busier roads in Orange County . Took 15 minutes to checkin with only one customer in front of us. Sheets had stains, road noise significant and a small mandatory "surplus" charge for s mini safe in the room regardless if you use it or not. Advertises free breakfast , basic cereal and pastries no eggs or meat, you have better options all around the area

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay, friendly staff
Summary: I stayed here for two nights because of my home being fumigated. Decent price with a microwave and fridge. Place was clean and they were even able to get me into a room hots earlier than I had hoped for. I'd stay again
Great  place staff was really nice breakfast could have been alot better... Please add more varitey
I was dissatisfied by the fact that the tv did not work properly and the ice machine was hard to get to for a handicapped person. I was also accused of having a pet which I did not have.
room and fixtures were outdated and dirty.  bed was lumpy and there as a long strand of black hair in the tub.  Not impressed.
The property is not well-maintained.  The bathroom wasn't clean.  The breakfast room was extremely tiny and so over-crowded, I didn't even attempt to get in.  I would not recommend this motel.

We have enjoyed our stay at Days Inn, in Fountain Valley, Ca. The staff is absolutely amazing, Amanda you are an so pleasant, cordial, and welcoming. Although, the comp breakfast is limited....it's free. Rooms are in need of updating, however, the linens are fresh smelling, clean (not dingy). My only soft complaint is, nothing to sit on except the bed and an desk chair. Housekeeping Techs, are friendly. The hotel  in a safe area, quite safe. You are within 5 to 7 miles of most restaurants, fast foods, grocery stores, etc. Most importantly the rates are reasonable. We'll be Back!

Good location right off the 405 (but not if having a room overlooking the freeway bothers you). The rooms were nicer than I expected. I didn't have the breakfast, but it looked typical. The good sized room had an updated bathroom, a refrigerator and a microwave. I stayed for 7 nights while visiting family in my hometown. I was very happy with this hotel and plan to stay here again next time I visit.

Summary Heading: REMEMBERING OMAR AND THE DAYS INN
Summary: The property is old, but the attitude of your night man, Omar, is new and "engaged!" This very intelligent, thoughtful man "made my stay" on Tuesday night of this week. I believe that what's ahead for Omar is probably greater than what is benind, a long struggle to improve his life and career here in American!!  Your lobby is also attractively done, and the lady who "mans" the breakfast room is very nice. Thus I will probably be back when working in the area!  Omar, I am the man with that 17 year old white Lexus...  John Selck  johnselck@aol.com
Very small room where the bed is, not comfortable, the tv doesn't work well and the carpet looked dirty

I've stayed here before. A mile from my business. We were able to use points so got a really good rate. This hotel is very clean. I think they offer a breakfast but I never went in. A Starbucks is one block and a Tommy's burgers. Right by the FWY but that never disturbs me. I travel alone and feel very safe at this hotel.

Summary Heading: felt like a burden to the manager.
Summary: As much as I love the deal and comfort at the days inn, this particular one has a very persistent manager. Lee loves to call you to make sure your going to check out, he explained that I made a mistake when I booked online, although my recipt was correct, but he still called me to the office just to charge me 20 dollars more for my room. He told me not to bring food in my room as it would cause a mess, but there's a fridge so I guess I'm not sure what I'm supposed to use that for... I have stayed at this hotel about 4 times in the last month and every time I get a phone call from lee for somethin he likes to consider my mistake.. I refuse to stay at this days inn anymore due to the feeling of being harassed. Lee needs to realize the tourist from China are not the only customers
Manager Response: Dear Chellyre26, Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to tell us of your stay. I am so sorry, if your stay could have been better.  All guests are my most priority, and when you extend your stay, day by day. My most concern is to make sure we have the room available for you. I hate to inform any guests that we do not have the room available. As you mentioned, we had many groups at the hotel during your stay and the room availability was very limited, I wanted to make sure we had room available for you if you needed it. Please accept my apology.  Again, thank you so much.

Summary: Thank you to Meagan from Indianapolis office in correcting an error in booking. Desk clerk at check in was very pleasurable. Same with check out clerk. Enjoyed my stay. Second time there, would definitely stay there again.
I was very disappointed when checking in and advised there would be a $100 deposit for incidentals.  The drapes didn't close all the way, room was on the freeway side, very noisy.
I was visiting my Mother hospitalized nearby. Theven Days Inn provided the amenities needed for my brief stay.

Summary Heading: Colorado visit to Fountain Valley for Christmas
Summary: Bathroom mirror in rm 318 in awful shape and needs replacing, no guide to TV, elevator was grinding with wierd smell, toilet paper and Kleenex were sub-standard.  TP had no tear off sheets, just one continual piece of paper...maid service was adequate though and the bed was firm w/clean linens.  Towels were thin and scratchy, w/no shampoo and conditioner.  Soap bars were teeny tiny and didn't really ever lather.  Hot water was good once you waited for tap to change up to 10 minutes.  A real waste in water! Reception was pleasant but unaware of $100 security deposit upon checking in.  Traffic noise from freeway was evident. Stairwells had broken concrete thresholds that need repairing.  Grounds nicely kept.  Continental breakfast not worth much.  Coffee weak and no creamer.

Clean, quiet, and easily accessible. Places to shop nearby. Amusement park, Roller Skating Rink and other recreation for kids and adults right next door. Complimentary Wi-Fi. No hot food but nice basic selection of items like cereal, yogurt, fruit & Danish with plenty of hot coffee for the complimentary breakfast. Personable and friendly staff. Office attended 24 hours. Not a location for light sleepers or those who need quiet to sleep soundly. There is lots of noise from the 405 freeway right behind the hotel. Could use an iron with board in the rooms. Somewhat okay for the price.
I'm handicapped sidewalks and walkways were uneven, had puddles of water on walk walkways Cleaning women. Opened the the door at 9am

My stay there was very pleasant.  The room was clean and well stocked, and the bed was very comfortable. Although near the freeway, there was very little noise and I was able to get a restful night's sleep after a long car trip.  The front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating, as well. The only issue I noted was that the in-room refrigerator wasn't working, but as I did not need to use it I just I reported it to the front desk person upon checkout.  Overall, I was very satisfied with my stay!

It was our first stay at Days Inn and I was nervous because it's built right next to the 405. We were assigned a room on the inside away from the freeway on the office side.   We had no problem with noise,  our room was comfortable and spacious.  The rooms on the office side are a little larger and actually 2 room suites with the bathroom between them.  We had a microwave and a refrigerator and coffee maker.  I put the regular and decaf coffee packets together and had the best in room coffee ever. The rooms are not elaborately decorated and could be updated, but reasonably clean, spacious and comfortable beds and pillows.    The heater worked well and was not too noisy like some places.  We stayed for 7 days and will most likely stay there again. Great value if you reserve and

The room was in a great location for us and very affordable. It was clean, and well kept. It was very dated and the bed was not very comfortable. The pillows were tiny...  Over all it served its purpose but I probably wouldn't stay here again, unless it had been updated.
I stay here several times a year, because it's such a good value for the money.  All of the employees that I have encountered so far have been friendly and professional!

Horrible place, terrible breakfast, staff did not do anything to honour any requests .. Asked for top level, asked to be closed to our friends, asked to be close to the pool... Nothing was acknowledged   Will never go there again.  Our room reeked so much, horrible smell in the room and they would not switch me pretending the hotel was full. I had to take antiestamine to be able to breathe
Manager Response: Dear Marilyn B. Thank you so much, and I am so sorry that all your request was not filled.  We always do try our best to fulfill all requests, but all requests are upon availability. And I am so sorry that we could not give a 100% to you.  I realize that you requested upper floor. The hotel was sold out on the third floor, and we had to assign second floor nearest to the pool as requested. (3 doors from the pool) and your friend was given a room on same floor 5 doors away. The room was the nearest to your room as requested. Also, I am so sorry for the smell of the cleaning material and sanitizer spray in the room.  Again, please accept my apology of not able to fulfill your request 100% but as an employee of the hotel, we could not guarantee all request, but we do try our best to fulfill any requests.  Again, thank you.

Summary: I will not recommend this hotel to anyone!! The management is rude and the rooms are dirty... The 2nd day i was there, the manager called me one morning telling me that my guest dirty the sheets and that he had to throw it away..  I asked him what it was, he said "sir, your guest may have pooped herself " 😳😳 My guest is 30 years old professional who came here from Europe to see if we could put our 30 graduating students in this hotel next June..  All that took place was my guest inadvertently  dropped a piece of chocolate on the bed..  We wanted out of this hotel right away... When i told the manager it was only a piece of chocolate he then said " ohh ok, then i will not charge you " ??? TripAdvisor, You should take that hotel away from your listings ... Seriously!!
Manager Response: Dear Sir, Thank you so much for your input. And I did call you in the morning to ask if everything was Okay in the room with a concern for the guest. And I did ask you about the accident in the room. When you informed us of the guest not feeling well from the long trip, I really did not want to embarrass you or the guest and bring it up any further about the incident. I am so sorry, but the accident was not a small smudge of chocolate. But my main concern was not the Embarrass you or your guest any more.  I am so sorry if you felt that I was rude to you in any way, but I always give my upmost respect to all guests. And when you shook my hand at the time of check out and thanked me for the stay, and when you wish to come back after the holiday to discuss and arrange the lodging needs for the students I thought you were pleased with the 5 nights stay. I am so sorry if the average rate I have given in the brief conversation at the time of check out did not meet the budget of the students.  Again, Thank you.

Summary: Outdated and expensive. The only positive was Omar the night clerk. I wont ever come back. Hair on my bathroom floor. When I told the day clerk her response was "oh"....internet slow.....they threaten to charge $10 for your room key....everyone in America has cards....breakfast...not edible. I wasted a yard of my money. I would have been better off sleeping in my car.
Manager Response: Dear Tam F.  Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to tell us about your stay. And please accept my apology if you had any issue with the internet. But we had done a complete internet upgrade couple of months ago with all new AP around the building and also a new contract with a new ISP for much faster and better internet experience to all guests.  Also, many hotels use a different method of security for the guest rooms, but the most common are the card keys. The reason for that is because the card keys cost only pennies, depending on the type. But we decided to stay with the computer USB keys for the security and safety of the guests. These keys are very expensive, but I think safety is more valuable then the cost of the keys. And that is why we request to please return the keys at check out if possible. But we will not threaten any guests.  Please accept my deepest apology for a hair on the floor, I will have the house keeping be more  careful.  Again, please accept my apology and thank you so much.

Summary: Room was clean, door was a bit hard to close and loud as I had to slam from outside.  Breakfast items were lacking but for a hold-over till lunch it worked.  Staff were all very friendly and helpful and houskeeping were great.  not tub and pool were good and parking lot was always quiet.  I would stay here again with no reservations.  It is close to eating places, shopping, and very accessible from 405

Breakfast served in poor tastes and old fruits. The pillows are old and deteriorated, therefore, it caused a neck and backaches. It is located next to I405, and causes noisy at nite. Overall, it is rated poor.
This hotel was reasonably priced for location of where we were needing a place to stay at. Starbucks within walking distance.

The reason why we got the hotel was so we do not drink and drive after a Halloween party next to the hotel.  They made us check out at 11 am and I asked if we can have a late check out (in which most hotels would let us checkout at 1 or 1:30pm) and the lady said sure that we could check out at 11:30 and no later.  This will be the last time I will stay there.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying at Days Inn and also thank you so much for not drinking and driving.  I apologize for not being able to fulfill your request for the late check out, but late checkout request is upon availability.  When we are very busy and expecting the groups to check in, we do need to have to rooms prepared and ready.  Again, please accept my deepest apology for not being able to fulfill you request.

Summary Heading: Clean and convenient.  Our room faced the 405 freeway...
Summary: Clean and convenient.  Our room faced the 405 freeway, which was noisy, but we just kept the A/C on and it was fine.

I stayed in the hot tub suit and didn't expect much for the price I paid. The room was spacious with a separate sitting area, as was the tub that could easily fit 4. The only reason I'm not ratting 5 is because of the location next to the freeway.Noise is bearable though

Summary Heading: The only thing that could be improved is the breakfast.  At...
Summary: The only thing that could be improved is the breakfast.  At other Wyndham facilities most of them have some sort of hot breakfasts.  Waffles, eggs etc.

My opinion about Days Inn has been completely soured by one negative experience. The room was terrible, A/C broken during a SoCal heat wave, and checking in/out was a nightmare scenario. I wouldn't stay at another Days Inn, even if it were free

Summary Heading: The carpets are filthy! There was not a microwave in our...
Summary: The carpets are filthy! There was not a microwave in our room. tThe maintanance man had to come in several times to put one in.

Summary Heading: The most important factor when I stay at a hotel is...
Summary: The most important factor when I stay at a hotel is cleanliness. Everything else is relative to the value paid. This hotel / my room was clean overall. Decor is okay, nothing impressive. Good location. The window to my room faced the busy 405 freeway so I was able to hear the early morning traffic. Everything was average, I would stay here again in the future.
I stayed here for about a week and the manager of days inn was so amazing and helpful. We will definitely be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Great value, clean rooms, convenient location
Summary: Fine motel near Huntington Beach, very clean rooms. My bath room was fresh and remodeled, the location close to freeway I-405 exit Magnolia/Warner in Fountain Valley is a little noisy but also convenient. Rooms are spacious, housekeeping very effective, and the smallish pool is a nice treat. I stayed for nine nights. Breakfast served 6 to 9 am. Overall great value.

This hotel was not a good stay...first room I had, the couch which was actually a futon, had springs poking at you. All the padding was worn out...something you would pick up on the side of the road...I complained since I wanted to use the couch to watch TV in the front room, when I wasn't working at the desk by the couch... (bdrm in the back room)...anyway they gave me another room which had a much nicer couch, but now there was no TV in the front room to watch...I moved the desk to the back bd rm where the TV was and made it work...oh yea, the second room I had to tell them it needed made up since the bed had been slept in and towels on the floor???? Then the "Continental brkfst" room didn't have the AC on so you get 30 people in ther packed like sardines, sweating for
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Barry A. Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to tell us of you stay. I am so sorry about the room not being properly ready for you, but when you requested for a new room, I believe you needed to go to work in the morning and did not have much time to wait. I have requested that the room will be ready for you in couple of hours, or by the time when you come back. I am so sorry for any misunderstanding.  Please accept my deepest apology.   Again, thank you so much.

Summary: We just needed a stay on our way to L.A. For one night it was fine. The rooms were big, the TV was ok. We had a fridge & microwave in our room. The bathroom especially the mirror has seen better times, but everything was clean! Breakfast was included, but we didn't go cause we are both vegan ;)

Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were not that awesome. Cleaning staff never replaced towels. Beds not very comfortable. Positives are that the location is right off the freeway. Very good price and close to huntington beach. Starbucks and sports authority are in the shopping center across the street. The location and the low price are the best qualities this hotel has to offer.

Summary Heading: Have stayed before and will be staying there again
Summary: We also enjoy our stay at Days Inn.  We have family in HB so this makes for a perfect location.  The rooms are nice and the staff our very well trained.

My husband and I were in Huntington Beach for the Surfing US Open finals. HB room rates had been pushed sky high. The next tier out were either way high in price, full or scary dives. So, we moved even further out.  I had stayed her twice before sans hubby to visit with our daughter and had hoped to splurge for something fancier, but not US Open fancy.  So, I brought him to this place.  If you want an inexpensive (for HB area) place that is a short drive to all the action, this is your spot.  It is under $100. It's dated, simple, clean. This is my third stay and on each occasion staff has always been a cut above - welcoming, friendly, helpful. For an older hotel, it has been maintained. There is a large, good looking, clean pool (I've never used) that has been pretty much empty

Summary Heading: Gnats in our room.... Every time we check in to this hotel...
Summary: Gnats in our room.... Every time we check in to this hotel there are gnats in our room. We have to spend the fist 15 minutes killing gnats...
Walked in the lobby to check in and was greeted by 2 very nice employees that explained everything we needed to know

Came back expecting to see a made bed and clean room but house keeping didnt come until after 5pm. My bathroom had hair in it. Overall room just looked old and not clean. Lots of great things to do at walking distance though:). But wont stay here again.. Internet sucked! Better yet i had no internet :((
The door had a crack in the door frame; the ac barely worked, I had to keep the AC at 60 and it didn't even work; the bed was terrible; wifi sucked, could not even load Netflix or Hulu;

After reading the negative reviews before we got there I was prepared to find another place to stay after one night.  What I found was friendly & helpful staff.  The room was clean w/o any chemical smell.  The linens & towels were clean.  We used the air conditioner the whole time and did not hear much of the traffic....in fact we slept like logs.  With 2 adults & 3 active kids the room was a bit small....BUT instead of spending an extra $100/nite on a little larger room...we used that money to spend on activities with the kids.  We stayed 6 nights. Another plus...no parking or resort fee.
Stained carpets, hairs found on the towels in the bathroom, lumpy bed, TV reception fuzzy.  Felt very unsavory.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know of your stay. And I am so sorry to see that you had couple of issues. I will be sure to use these information to better our quality and for better experience for all guests.  Thank you so much!

Summary: Needed a place to sleep while my apartment was being fumigated. This place is absolutely no-frills all the way down the line, but the room cost 35% more than it should. Had to force the door open with my shoulder and then had to force it closed. Freeway noise started at 5 am, breakfast was stingy and poor quality. Breakfast room was so crowded I couldn't sit down, so I went back up to my room and made the lousy in-room coffee - took 5 minutes for 2 nasty cups. This used to be a decent property several years ago, but I wouldn't stay here again, especially not at the price charged.

This hotel is next to the freeway,  really in it the nose is so bad you have an automatic alarm starting at 5am. Not only did the freeway boar wake us but the bed mattress was 100 % broken down.  The springs were coming thru and the pillows were broken down into lumps, like they had been washed and there were 3 separate cotton lumps shoved into the pillow case.

The rooms were very plain.  The mirror in the bathroom had stains all over it. There was no conditioner or lotion in the room. The breakfast, if you want to call it that, didn't have much, very sad. If you wanted to use a debit/visa card you had to leave $100 deposit. We will not be staying there again.
The room had a musty smell, torn couch, and very uncomfortable bed. I did not sleep a wink! The pillows were half size of normal ones. The last time i go to a Days Inn.
Room was nice and staff very friendly. Ive had better Contenetial breakfast at others hotels. Breakfasts needs improvement more of a selection would be nice.

Summary Heading: The hotel room floor was filthy my children's feet were...
Summary: The hotel room floor was filthy my children's feet were black from walking barefoot on the carpet!  My daughter got in bed and woke up in the morning with gum on her back from the sheets!  The beds were so uncomfortable we couldn't sleep every time we moved or turned over the bed squeaked so bad! We will never stay at this Days Inn ever again and because of this experience we will most likely not stay at any other Days Inn either!  I understand all hotels were sold out in the area but to charge $140 for one night in this hotel was absolutely ridiculous and not worth that price ever!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know of your stay and I am so sorry. Like many hotels, we have company come in every week to steam clean group of rooms per visit. We cannot clean all the rooms at once but we rotate rooms per trip. Also, all the linens are contracted out with a Nation Wide linen company to assure best quality linens to guest.  Again, I am so sorry for your trouble.  Thank you so much.

Summary Heading: Rest rooms need to be updated, rust all over the faucets...
Summary: Rest rooms need to be updated, rust all over the faucets and fan wasn't working. Mattress need to be replaced. Good location tho.

From the moment we got there to the moment we check out was just horrible! We paid for a room with 2 Queen beds and got 2 Full beds, my shampoo spilled and they could only provide us with 1 small bottle for the 4 of us. When we asked for new towels on the 2nd day they told us that they didn't think they could get 4 towels for us. We came back to the hotel at 11pm with my 2 small children sleeping in the car and we did not had a place to park and were told to park next door at the theme park and walk around, The mangier did end up working something out after my husband got upset about not having a place to park where we were paying to stay, If you decide to book with them be prepared to be sleeping next to the freeway it is VERY loud all night. Last but not least when we were

Summary Heading: D I S G U S T I N G
Summary: Stopped in For Quick, clean place to sleep for a reasonable rate199.0 cash/ 100 deposit,,,,,,,,,, saw room Uhhhhhhh............ Hell No! Front desk Guy " Omar" tried to keep our Money! Ha......... Told him I will call Law, he returned all of it. Good luck if You M U S T stay here😷😩

We stayed her because our regular place was full. Upon entering we were overcome with the smell of cleaning products and everything seemed dingy. It didn't help that our room was right next to the freeway as many of the rooms are, and the sheets were scratchy.  The breakfast was marginal. Overall, we weren't impressed and won't be staying here again.

I would not return to this Day's Inn.  The location is RIGHT next to the freeway and it is very loud. The rooms are old and need to be updated.  The WiFi doesn't stay connected and you have to repeatedly re-login.  The small pool is padlocked and has to be opened by management, even during the posted hours of operation. The breakfast area is small & stocked with the very basics. There is no washer/dryer available.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to let us know of your stay. I am so sorry about the noise from the freeway. And we are in process in getting a 20 feet high Sound Wall, also all windows are double panel.  Again, please accept my deepest apology.  Thank you.  BK Lee, Manager

Summary: I needed a place fast and i didn't have much to pick from. My room overlooked the freeway and this is the only hotel that made me give them a deposit do to my credit card being linked to my bank.

Stayed for 4th of July weekend because we were playing a softball tournament nearby. If you're fine with an inexpensive rate for a motel that needs a renovation, this property is you. The rooms were clean, the front desk staff and management very nice. Beds were a little hard but you get what you pay for. The rooms had fridges and safes, which was actually more than I expected. Also, there is a Boomers and skating rink next door for family fun.

The service was not the friendliest. The room was okay, but the bed was very squeaky and there was no shampoo in the bathroom, only hand soap. We asked for extra towels to use at the pool and were told to use the ones in our room. When we asked a second time we were told to take them from the maids cart. Our room was ready at 3:00, but other rooms were still being cleaned at 5:00. We went to use the pool and the area had a lock on it. We had to find someone to unlock it for us. We were meeting someone there the second night of our stay and when we called to ask them to allow her into our room the clerk would not do so. When my husband went to check out he noticed that they had charged us for a safe, which we did not use. This is not the first time this has happened at a Days
Hey location was difficult to get to from Expressway to breakfast needs improvement no eggs small oranges for fruit only wait or white toast. He could hear the people next to us late into the night
Manager Response: Dear Maria O. Thank you again for taking time out of your busy schedule to let us know of you stay. I hope your son had a great hockey games.  As I have apologized earlier, I apologize again for the soccer team that checked in during your last day of stay. The team was 10 and 12 years old and I deeply apologize again if they bothered you during the check in. We do also have a very healthy deluxe continental breakfast for all guests, but I am so sorry that we do not provide eggs.  Again, thank you so much for your input.

Summary Heading: Good days at Fountain Valey and Huntington Beach
Summary: I stayed for two nights and had a nice experience.  Like others reviews, I think the staff was super friendly and the rooms were clean and quiet. The breakfast was fine, but the internet was a little slow. The hotel has a good price and probably I will return to this place again.

the room was WAY too small for two beds,the carpet was disgusting (like so grimy that our shoes were sticking), the room smelled musty, beds were incredibly uncomfortable, it felt like there were bed bugs !!! the elevator make a loud creeking noise that sounded like the cable was going to snap, the breakfast was in a very small room crowded with tables - made it hard to get to the cereal which was on the other side of the room.... when we were there , a few men in a pick up truck were storing their personal belongings in the hotel storage(?)...I mean like high chair, baby walker, baby swing etc. there was an employee that lives on the first floor hanging her laundry to dry.. we had to duck under their clothing to get to our room. i will NEVER stay here again. everything was
Manager Response: Dear Diana B.  Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to inform us of you stay. I am so sorry that your stay could have been better.  Sometime, we do allow some regular guests to store some bulky items at the hotel for the guest's comfort, to be use when returning to hotel in future. Even though we do have many sports teams at the hotel, we do not allow any guests to hang the clothing outside. And like many hotels, all the rooms goes through a schedule carpet cleaning, and we do have a onsite 24 hours maintenance person for the guest's rooms if needed. I apologize for any misunderstandings.  Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: We stayed for four nights and had a wonderful experience. The staff was super friendly and the rooms were clean and quiet. It was a great price and we were not too far from the beach. There was outdoor seating and a clean pool area.

This wasn't the nicest nor the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. It was clean, but the rooms were small, the carpet was gross and the internet was incredibly slow. The swimming pool was nice, albeit a little small and cold. The breakfast was fine, but the room was very small. I felt like a sardine my entire stay at this hotel.

Generally the service and stay was satisfactory.  However, I was concerned that at 11:00 our power was temporarily shut off to our room as an indication that we needed to leave even though we had obtained approval for an extended check out at 11:30.  If that was the purpose of the short power outrage that was very rude and unnecessary.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Ed. Thank you so much for letting us know of your stay, and I am extremely sorry for the short power outage.  This must have been a random power outage in the area. Please accept our apology.  Thank you so much again.

Summary Heading: Great location and fair rates nice staff and manager
Summary: They have a good breakfast and take care of any requests when booking a room.Great location and fair rates nice staff and manager.They really care about your every need.Lee the manager does a wonderful job and will go out of his way to suit your needs or requests whenever possible.Thanks very much Days Inn Fountain Valley see you all real soon Joey.
Hotel is old and needs to be refurbished. It was a good value from a price perspective, however, I expected a nicer room with a Days inn property.
Front office staff was rude and tried to tell us our pre paid room was not ready at check in. The room was dirty and the noise was out of control.

Clean room, it was a bit small but staff was friendly. It was a last minute booking and we were accomdated just fine and breakfast was satisfying. Friendly housekeepers. There was a lot of noise because of the freeway being so close but we likes our stay.

This is the best Days Inn I have ever stayed at in my 40 years traveling around the world.  The room is excellent, clean, updated and comfortable.  It's like a home away from home atmosphere.  Mr. Lee, Omar and Chelsea have gone out of their way to help make my stay the best experience a business traveler could hope for.  I will stay at this hotel many more times and advise my work comrades to do the same.   The location is in a great neighborhood, close to easy access to the highway, and surrounded by some World Famous restaurants too.  I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the outstanding staff!  Just a great all around experience!

Kept coming back to this hotel whenever visiting  So. Cal, everything is fine except price is high for its 2 stars hotel rate. It was only $49 back then, now is $98. Lots of improvements recently, thought.
The Days Inn & Suites Fountain Valley was very clean.  The staff was friendly and helpful, and the continental breakfast was very good.

Too noisy as it is just beside the freeway so was not able to sleep soundly through the night. The insulation could have been improved. There was no water in the shower when we turned it on. Called the attention of the front desk, nothing happened. Parking facility was safe though.  The facility smell of cleaning detergent, kids were complaining.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your recent stay and for taking time out of your busy schedule to let us know of your stay. At this time we are testing many different insulations to better the stay for the guests. And on the day of your check in, our technicians were changing the boiler filters and the water was turned off for 1 hour. I deeply apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.  Thank you so much again.

Summary: The staff was unpleasant and lazy. We stayed there for 4 nights and our room was cleaned once. We called the desk asking for towels and twice they didn't have any cleaned. The television did not work and the front desk lady told us she couldn't do anything about it and she didn't know the wifi password either.
Manager Response: Mrs. Brittany V., I am so sorry that your stay could have been better. Please accept our apology. Our house keepers clean the rooms every day, except the rooms with a sign on the door. And I apologize...  On December of 2014, we have replaced the entire hotel with brand new LG pro-idiom, LED televisions. I apologize that the television plug was unplugged. We always strive to give better experience to all guests, and on February of 2015 we have done a new internet construction for better connections for all guests.  Again, please accept our apology. And we will do our best for better experience all guests. And thank you so much.

Summary: We were originally going to stay for 6 nights but left after one. The motel does not work well for families on vacation, there are people smoking and drinking outside the rooms, the pool area is very small, the water is stagnant and the manager has to let you in to the pool area with his key - you have to go to the office in order to be let into the pool for safety reasons. The police patrol through the lot periodically. Not a good place for children.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to tell us of your stay and how we can offer better experience. And, we are so sorry that you needed to cut your stay short At the hotel, we always lock the pool area at 10 pm, and reopen at 10 am or when the guest request to enter the pool area, for the safety of the guests and also to respect the guests sleeping. We are a Non-smoking room hotel, and we do request all smoking guests to smoke in a smoking area outside.  Again, Thank you so much for your time and your stay.

Summary Heading: Staff was great, lots of noises, due to freeway on back and...
Summary: Staff was great, lots of noises, due to freeway on back and domestics happening 3 doors from our room. Breakfast can use some scramble eggs other than just bread.

Summary Heading: The room was pleasant, clean, and quiet.  I was...
Summary: The room was pleasant, clean, and quiet.  I was particularly impressed with the manager.  We was very alert to cars coming onto the hotel grounds.  He was very concerned for our comfort and well being.  He told me that he doesn't sleep much so that his guests can sleep comfortably.

Summary Heading: The room furniture needs to be updated.  A couple of chairs...
Summary: The room furniture needs to be updated.  A couple of chairs need to be added. A TV in the livingroom would make the stay more enjoyable.

The pillows were terrible. They were soft rocks. There were 3 pillows on the bed. In all of them the batting in the pillows was balled into rock shapes, but softer than rocks. But still hard to be comfortable on. Internet was also terrible. When it connected it would take minutes to load a simple google search page. Forget trying to check your e-mail or facebook. Attempting to watch a video would be out of the question. "High Speed Internet Access" (as advertised on the website) my butt! Also, when we got to the room and went to use the internet there was a password on it that they didn't even give when we checked in. Had to call the desk to get it. The shower: The curtain was impossible to keep closed. It would CONSTANTLY pull from one side or the other to the middle of the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to let us know of your stay. And I am so sorry to hear about the internet trouble.  The hotel has recently done a new access point construction and signed a new contract with a new internet provider. In couple of weeks, we will have faster and better internet for everyone.  Again, thank you for your time.

Summary Heading: Photocopy Your ID - Possible ID Theft
Summary: The front desk asks for your ID as is usual practice to verify your credit card matches your ID. However, what is not normal or usual is that they take a photocopy of your ID and place it on the back of your check-in paperwork. This is odd and not normal.   No one at the front desk or the manager was able to give a satisfactory reason why this was done and what happens to the paper later. I was told, "The paper is kept in a safe place." Safe per who? How do I know that some staffer, maintenance crew, random worker doesn't have access to the records? How do I know that the records are locked and safe? How do I know that the location is safe or secure? I don't know this.   I asked what happens to old records. The front desk did not have any idea what happens to the old records.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for take time out of busy schedule to address your concern. Each and every hotel has different check in policy, but one common thing about all hotels is that safety and security of all guests are top priority. All documents are stored in locked office, and all documents that are no longer needed are cross shredded.  I realize that identity theft is a concern for many people, but please be assure that from the credit card company to banks and all business are here to protect your security. Again, thank you so much for your time.  BK Lee

Summary: Room was adequate for a two night stay. Staff was positive and helpful. I-405 interstate noise was noticeable, but not enough to disturb our night's sleep. Tony's hamburger shop is within walking distance and has very good food. Skip the chili sauce on the hamburger, it's very messy and not that tasty. Overall, the experience met our needs for this stay.

We had the King suite. The rooms were large enough for a short stay.  The bathroom was clean. The bed was comfy. There was a mini fridge and a microwave.  The area appeared safe and we did not have any problems. Walked to Starbucks for coffee every morning.  Breakfast was OK.  yogurt, cereal, coffee, juice.  Friendly front desk personnel.  The 405 right outside the window, but we barely heard it.  A good rug shampoo would help, but everything was nice and clean for us.  (The pull out couch needs to be replaced.)  For the cost, and location, this was a good place and I would come back. We did have troubles connecting to WIFI with the computer, and it was spotty with our phones.

Summary Heading: The room was cleam and the staff was nice. My one complaint...
Summary: The room was cleam and the staff was nice. My one complaint is that it was very loud due to load slamming nose from the upstairs guest. I called and complained and it was not resolved.

My wife and I stayed here while our house was having new floors installed (we live in Fountain Valley).  For $72 we got a king bed "suite" (really two tiny interconnected rooms.  It was room 103, whose bedroom window is nearly level to and only a few feet from Interstate 405.  The traffic noise is muffled and becomes "white noise" that didn't bother us.  To accommodate the king bed the air conditioner/heater that protrudes beneath the window had to be scrunched against one side of the bed, making access to that side of the bed almost impossible.  The room had a flat screen tv, (no HD, and some channels were very distorted.  The free internet was terribly slow, with downloads ranging from 3.6 to 83.6 KB/s.  The free continental breakfast offered few choices, but was satisfactory.

Everything was fine until after I checked out, apparently the manager decided after I had left the property that he wasn't going to give back my entire security deposit of $200. When I departed I was given my receipt of all my charges and refunds of the deposits, if there was a problem it should have been addressed at that time and not after I had left the property.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to address your concern. At all times we do make several attempts to contact a guest in regarding to any additional charges. If you could please call or email me, I would be happy to inform you the details to your charges.  Again, thank you so much for informing us of your concern.

Summary Heading: I should have just slept in my car
Summary: The room was disgusting. Sheets didn't appear to have been changed. They advertise having items at the front desk if you forgot something, however when asked they did not have toothbrushes and charged for a crappy razor.
Manager Response: Dear Sir, I am so sorry you had such experience. We are a few hotel that service the linens to outside nationwide company to insure the best, clean and most comfortable linens to our guests. I will assure you that your comments will be used to increase the standards of the company. We do also have a standard toothbrush and razors for the guests at no charge, but we also have a traveler's set that is sold.  Again, please accept our sincere apology

Summary: It was the loudest room I have ever stayed in. Why you would put a room next to the freeway is crazy!! I would never stay at this hotel if they paid me to stay there.

My husband and I have stayed at your hotel several times for family visits to our son and his family.  We have always enjoyed the location and the stores and restaurants near by.  We always feel comfortable and safe.

Good clean rooms. Customer service was very exceptional. My only beef.. NO INTERNET STREAMING!!!! REALLY??!! This place had a filter for every website known to man. No Netflix, No Hulu, I could not even log onto my company website. I do believe this is the only hotel on the planet with internet filters. Very disappointing.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking your time to tell us how we can improve in guest's experience.  The Management has just acquired a new contract with a new internet provider, and will be doing a new internet construction. This will increase the internet speed and usage by X15 times faster and better.  I deeply apologize for the issue with the internet during your overnight stay. When we had many guests using the internet, it does slow down.  Within weeks, all internet issue will be eliminated, and again, please accept my apology. And thank you so much for helping us to provide a better experience for all guests.

Summary: This hotel shares a parking lot with a roller skating rink, a Sports Authority and a miniature golf complex. If you have kids, this is a fun place to stay. If you need a good night's sleep, and traffic noise is a problem, this might not be for you. I had a very difficult time sleeping because the hotel is right near the 405. Trucks honking in the middle of the night, etc.

Summary Heading: Outstanding! Best place to stay within miles. Great people.
Summary: I've stayed here before and am back again as this hotel is wonderful. They have breakfast, it's very, very clean, and each and every employee here is so kind and helpful and always smiling. Just like their Manager Mr. Lee. I can't say enough nice things about this Days Inn. I would stay here every time I need a place to stay. You can tell their number one priority is making sure their customers are happy, and I have always been very happy here. Everything is here you need. Their kindness, helpfulness and smiles go a long way. Mr. Lee makes sure everything is smooth, and also that his employees are happy. You can see that in the way you are treated. Make sure if your looking for a great place to stay, come to this Days Inn.

This it a good value for the money. I've stayed in a pricier hotel in the same town and the cost was almost double, with no frig, microwave, internet, or breakfast!  The staff is very professional and friendly.

The check-in is quick and easy. Parking is convenient, as is the continental breakfast in the morning. The coffee served in the continental breakfast is good.The area right around the hotel seems really safe, not like some places I have stayed right off a freeway. We have stayed twice now, this year and last year, both times in December, three nights each visit and we will likely continue to stay here when we come to Orange County.

Stayed Christmas weekend.  Room was typical hotel/motel type.  Did have refrigerator and microwave in room.  Room and bath was clean and modern.  Easy access to highway and short drive to beach.  Only complaint is that upon first entering the room there was a strong chemical cleaning smell.  After opening window and running AC on vent it was much better.

Hotel was mistakenly booked on a same-day request for a hotel which needed to be "close to the Santa Ana train station". Turns out it is 10 miles away and a $40 cab ride each way. Hotel refused request for refund upon discovery by me of the problem. Blamed it all on Expedia but gave me 3 phony Expedia phone numbers for "working it out", all of which turned out to be recordings only. When advised of this, hotel still stood firm on "no refund policy" even though it was clear that I would not be staying there that night. Hotel desk clerk was rude and unsympathetic. Wouldn't lift a finger to try to help me. Kept me on hold for a very long time and did nothing to help.
Manager Response: I am so sorry to see that you had such difficulty in getting refunded by Expedia. Sometimes, depending on the type of reservation you book on line with the third party, refunds and cancellations are very difficult with the third party reservations. And for the security for the person that has made the reservation with the third party, we cannot mortify any reservations unless requested by the third party. Also hotel cannot refund a customer for the third party reservations because the payment has been given to the third party, Such as Expedia not to the hotel.  Again, I am so sorry that you had a difficult time with getting refunded by Expedia.

Summary: The refrigerator was so loud we couldn't sleep.  The bed was old and lumpy and sounded like it had paper under the mattress. The room was right next to the laundry room and was very noisy. The microwave and refrigerator were not plugged in. They had to bring an extension cord.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments on your stay, and I am so sorry that your stay was not the best of experience. I will use your thoughts to train our crews to assure a better experience for all guests. Please accept my deepest apology, and Thank you.

Summary: Stayed at better places, but also stayed at worse places.  No front room windows was odd, the room did have windows, but it was on the side of the very busy 405 freeway, so if you wanted some fresh air, you'd have to listen to traffic.  Wasn't a big thing, but kind of annoying all the time.  Bed had an imprinted indentation on one side of it, so when I rolled over, I felt like I was going to roll over onto the floor.  TV was an old 1980s style 20" inch TV.  Surprised there was no flat panel TV.  Channel choice was horrible, and remote didn't work according to the buttons.  These were all minor issues.  As I stated in first statement, I've stayed at worse places, so these above mentioned things were not that big of a deal.  The bathroom was nice and modern style.  Shower had good
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comment and we will definitely use it to improve on the experience of the guest's stay. As you have mentioned about the television, we have recently upgraded all the televisions to new LG Pro-idiom LEDs. And continuing to upgrade many things in the hotel. Again, I would like to thank you for your time and comments.

Summary: We have been staying at this hotel for several years each time we visit S. Cal. We are seniors and feel safe at this hotel. Mr. Lee is always around overseeing the property. The staff is friendly and always accommodating. They have a nice breakfast buffet, which is free and very filling. The location is in a good area of town and walking distance to restaurant, stores and Starbucks. There is a little amusement park on corner of street. Highly recommend this hotel it is a great value!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to write about your experience of your stay at the hotel.  I am so glad to see that you have enjoyed your stay, and as a manager of the property, there is no better award then to hear of a great stay and no greater compliment then a return guest.  PLEASE ACCEPT MY SINCERE THANK YOU!

Summary: We have stayed at least 5 times at the Days Inn and have never been disappointed. The rooms are clean and neat and the desk persons are friendly and efficient. We will stay there any time we need to go to Huntington Beach to visit our family.

The people making the reservation didn't put us in the room that we requested. We ended up taking a room that we didn't want, and one person had to sleep on the pullout. That wouldn't of been a huge problem, except the pullout was absolutely filthy. You could tell that it hadn't been cleaned in a long, long, time. The mattress was old, and it was like sleeping directly on the springs. It was so uncomfortable, that I basically didn't sleep for two nights straight...They put us in a room when we first got there, but it was infested with hornets, so we were moved to another room....The rooms are outdated, generally dirty, etc...bathroom lighting and Internet didn't work...I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: My 21 yr son came with me to stay the night before an early...
Summary: My 21 yr son came with me to stay the night before an early morning surgery at the local hospital. 1.The beds were hard and lumpy. 2. The air conditioner was more than just loud, sounded like it was on its last breath. That was almost  acceptable because it helped drown out... 3. The noise of the freeway. Needless to say, the hope of NOT being stressed out by driving the freeways before my surgery and to stay close backfired in the worst of ways. I will never return. I should have paid more to stay at the 2 better hotels in the same area. My health should never take the back hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to write your comments. We will use your opinion to assure better experience. Again, thank you so much.

Summary Heading: The buildings are nice.   The room was 'just' ok.   Some...
Summary: The buildings are nice.   The room was 'just' ok.   Some damage to walls.  Desk chair had torn material in several spots.   The TV was old and not the best picture.  Late into the evening there were groups of people up stair, on walk way, yelling and talking to the people in the pool area.   A lot of loud people and no one to control the noise or even care

Summary Heading: won;t stay at this days inn again
Summary: not happy when checking in said no discounts i had military id also had aarp card and still wouldn;t give a discount and every days in i stayed at has givin me a discount. also said i had to leave a 100.00 deposit for the room when paying with a debit card. i also have never been charged a deposit at a days inn. i needed the room for 3 nights but was told at check in it wasnt aviable would have to check out of that room and check into another the next night. sorry not happing i am handicap and dont like moving from room to room.and the lady at check in wasnt that friendly.

Regarding a deposit, many hotels have different policy with Debit cards and cash payments, and we do request a deposit of $ 100.00 when using these 2 forms of payment.  Again, please accept my deepest apology for any inconvenience these many have caused to you.  Thank you so much.

Summary: 1. The room was not cleaned when we checked in at 9:00 PM and the front office guy claimed they must have forgot to clean it! So that must be acceptable for this company.  2. It took them 40 min to clean our room 3. Wouldn't trust the people there if our life's depended on it
Manager Response: Dear Sir, Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to inform us of your experience, and with your comments, we will strive to give better experience to all guests. We were so sorry for the room not cleaned in time and we are extremely sorry for any inconvenience to you. I deeply apologize on behalf of all staff. This had never happened before but, we had a glitch in the system and house keeping that day, please accept my deepest apology. As a manager of the property, I do take full responsibility and I would humbly ask for your forgiveness.  Thank you,  BK Lee
