Summary: This hotel is terrible to stay at. Terrible service, no deposit reimbursement after multiple calls..
Manager Response: I am so sorry for the delay of deposit credit back to your account. The deposit is refunded at the time of check out, if there is no incidentals charges Depending on your finance institute, it will take 3-5 working days to be credited back to your account.  Thank you so much.  BK Lee

Summary: This Days Inn is cerebrally located to Knotts, Disney, and the beach. Very comfortable with friendly staff. Exterior of the building is in need of attention. Some of the vending machines were not operable.   Management did not enforce the distance factor of the smoking ordinance.  I would stay again simply because the basics that I need -- access and comfort -- are available.
Ok for a couple of nights.  Bus stop and Starbucks Coffee nearby  Enough number of towels   Breakfast with yogur and cereal

Summary Heading: Very Great Place to Stay in The O.C.
Summary: The hotel is clean and has great management with a nice pool and is close to the beaches,and Knotts Berry Farm,Disneyland and many more cool locations in the Orange County Area.I will stay ther again and again next visits.

Summary Heading: hotel was great, management was great, service was great...
Summary: hotel was great, management was great, service was great. overall it has been a good experience. will definitely be back.
I stayed at this hotel for 2 days and used a debit card was told i would be charged $100 for hold they took $200 out and it still hasn't been reversed 3 days after check out.

Well 1st I called the night before to see if they had early check in they told me to call in the morning & that as soon as someone checked out they would work in getting the room ready, now I told them I have a special needs child & we needed a bottom room they said ok we will work on it. So I called the next morning they said they should have room ready about 1pm, so we drove about an hour & 20 mins, when we got there they said room was Not ready. We went to get something to eat came back at 2pm Still not ready & House keepers just went to lunch they said room will not be ready til 3pm so we ended up sitting in the hot car waiting for a room to get cleaned. Then inside the room, Room is to small for 4 people, My son being autistic likes to play games on his ipad they said Free

I frequent this establishment on a regular basis. I have visited multiple hotels in this area, and have found this particular inn exceptional when compared to competitors. The Manager Lee is extremely amiable and provides outstanding customer service. If ever I have experienced even the slightest issue, it has been rectified in a matter of moments and the quality of my stay has never been compromised. The location in spite of being near the freeway (which has never been a problem regardless of the location of your room) is excellent in terms of accessability to surrounding areas and attractions. The spectrum, Bella Terra, the beach etc... are all relatively close and there is a skating rink and family fun center neighboring the hotel. Overall I would strongly recommend this

The room was average. It smelled bad and the airconditioner was noisy. The cleaning lady didn't come to clean until midafternoon. Since we had left very early to go to a morning wedding, we came back to room around 2pm. When she came we were trying to nap so didn't get room cleaned.

If all you need is a relatively clean, quiet place to sleep, then you found it here.  It is a very basic room with the basic amenities..room fridge, tv (not the flat kind), table, chair, etc. Bathroom fixtures look new and clean. The room does smell very chemically when you first walk in, as others have said.  If you were looking for a soft bed and sheets, they are not here. The sheets were rough and the pillows were lumpy and tall.  All in all, we spent two nights and it was okay. Staff was nice and as I said before, the room as surprisingly quiet.
We always ask for a room away from the Interstate traffic. Those rooms are very quiet.    I used the elevator all of the time due to medical difficulties.
Staff is very friendly and nice. Bed - Squeeking Breakfast - OK; Internet - BAD Area - too loud; Bad

Summary Heading: The rooms were in excellent condition.and very clean.  the...
Summary: The rooms were in excellent condition.and very clean.  the cleaning ladies were very polite and did an excellent job.  I have stayed in more expensive hotels, but none nicer.

Summary Heading: ONLY stay if you need a hotel right off the 405...only slightly better than sleeping in your car
Summary: We were on the way catch a flight out of LAX and thought it would be a good idea to stop halfway between Irvine and LAX...bad idea. We had a problem with a Hotels.com reservation which should have been easily resolved; however it took well over an hour with us sitting out in our car attempting to get the situation resolved.  We finally were successful; however when we got into our room, the room had a horrible odor...like chemical cleaning products but so strong that we had to open the window to the freeway.  The windows were filthy and the noise loud; however we had no choice if we wanted to try to dissipate the odor. The room was seriously in need ot a renovation from the florescent lighting to the dated bedspreads. Everything had a very "dirty" feel and, although normally I'm

I stayed for the 4th of July, so my room rates were doubled. I didn't have internet either day I was there, which caused my husband (a computer tech) to lose money. The jet bath tub didn't work, and the door to the room didn't work well (my 6 year old couldn't close it), the breakfast didn't offer any variety, and to top it off, we forgot something in the room and called before room service started in the morning and they didn't find it. Worst hotel I have stayed in...

I liked the room,it was a divided living room from the bedroom. It had  a microwave, refrigerator. The location was good.most of all it was quit!  I felt it needed updating. The bed seemed old,and had wood blocks holding it on the frame. The toilet ran. Off and on,they were very quick about coming to repair it, but,after he fixed it,it started again, I was tired and didn't want someone in there messing with it, so,that's my fault.  The hot tub,the manager,Lee said it needed something,not sure what,that it would be working the next day. I was disappointed. The next morning,the breakfast was pastries, breads,cereals, juices,coffee tea,looked good,my son liked it, i was going into orange memorial for surgery, so, I was fasting. I would give it another chance, just needs updating!!!'

I was in California for a job interview and this was my second time staying at this hotel and my first experience was fine. Because I was called in at the last minute I didn't have a chance to book my room ahead of time but I figured I'd take a chance. For my first night there was only a double available at $89 and the girl at the front desk said there'd be a single available the next night so I wouldn't have an issue there.   As a member of my alumni association one of the perks is being able to get a discounted rate at most Wyndham properties (15%) so imagine my surprise when even after (allegedly) inputting my corporate ID number, the room rate was still $89. Also, the price for the single the following night was (still) $79. After I had booked the first night the desk clerk

the hotel isn't bad, decent prices.  although the property is in decent shape and pretty clean, it is a bit overpriced for what you get - should be at least $5-$8 less than what you pay.  basic breakfast, nothing fancy, pretty basic.  it is right at the freeway, the sound doesn't bother me.

No. Don't do it. The place was absolutely terrible. The floors had what looked like blood stains, the blankets were stained, the bathroom was atrocious. Quickly checked out of there and got a refund. Just not acceptable for accommodations.  We went down the road to the Residence Inn, only paid $40 extra dollars(total, for the 3 days we were there) and that hotel was 1000x better and cleaner.

I have to say this place was not worth the $100 a night. The room smelled horrible. It was a mix of cleaning chemicals and mold. The beds weren't that comfortable. They charged me an additional $15 for my second adult in the room. The pool wasn't opened the first night we arrived. The only ice machine on the property didn't work. And we listened to the freeway noise all night. If you don't care about any of those mentioned, then the place it fine. If you don't like having those issues then I suggest going somewhere else. I felt I over paid for all the things that were wrong with this place. At least the front desk lady was nice.

Summary Heading: Getting checked in took a little longer than expected. The...
Summary: Getting checked in took a little longer than expected. The room was a little humid and had a musty smell to it but it wasn't overwhelming. It wasn't too bad but I probably wouldn't choose to stay there again.

Stayed at hotel due to location to a sporting event attending in area. Hotel is located right alongside 405 freeway which is very loud 24/7. Room was comfortable and clean, modern updated bathroom/shower. The beds were a  bit hard and bouncy and towels were not soft. Could not connect to internet with Iphone or Ipad, only Android. Poor wifi  Room smelled a bit musty and A/C not working well.  Breakfast was ok. Yogurt, toast, bagels, coffee and Orange Juice. Powered sugar and creamer for coffee and no lids for coffee cup so difficult to grab a cup and head out.  All in all, an ok place to stay for one night - bring ear plugs or sleeping pills  if you're a light sleeper.

Summary Heading: check-in process violated my personal information.

I had a comfortable visit the people at the Inn were very nice and it was at a very relevant location

Good location, check in and check out super quick. Very friendly. Windows do a good job in reducing noise, considering its right next to the 405 freeway, but for a light sleeper like myself, I had a hard time drowning out the traffic noise during the night and early morning. Not too terribly bad though. Two light bulbs were burnt out. The Kleenex box located on the bathroom wall behind the sink, which the metal frame was a bit oxidized. Bathroom though very clean, water pressure good. The comfort level of the bed could be improved, it squeaked too much and the pillows weren't too comfy. The Wifi was very bad, had to use my data on my cell. Overall though, felt safe and secure and spent the night. Average.

Summary Heading: its was Okay stay. rom service took long, pool dirty...
Summary: its was Okay stay. rom service took long, pool dirty,  rooms are somewhat comfortable, overall parking is very good and the workers are friendly.

Room was not even close to picture online, carpets really bad, walls were lumpy throughout room (nasty) lights were bad, tv didn't work...To top it all off after traveling for about 4hours we were not able to check in until after 7pm. Clerk said not their fault computers server down in las vegas? He said just go eat and come back later. no discount and no later check out.. never again will our softball team stay at this chain!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I was very happy with this hotel. I stayed here with my 14 yr. old daughter. It worked out great to drive to Huntington Beach one day and Disneyland the next. The service was great and the room was very clean and well kept. It had a mini-fridge and microwave too. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: This was an enjoyable experience. The reception was v good...
Summary: This was an enjoyable experience. The reception was v good. There was a lift to take us upto our room. The room was a suite but it's drawback was overlooking the freeway. Maybe the place should have been positioned better. The breakfast was better than we expected, The staff very helpful.

Summary Heading: Good value for money.   Basic accommodations.
Summary: I was visiting family and friends in Huntington Beach and just wanted a low cost room nearby.   I booked a room for three nights via Hotwire and paid in advance.   I ended up not staying there the first night since I was out late with friends.   When I checked in the next day the clerk advised me that since I had not checked in the day before, my Hotwire deal was cancelled and the room for 2 nights would now be higher than the 3 day price.  A little disappointing but it was my fault.  The next day I was in the office and the owner came out from the back to chat.   After hearing what had occurred, he wanted to waive the entire cost for the two nights.  I could not accept that offer and in the end we agreed on paying full price for one night and the second night free.   More than

A simple, straightforward, and satisfying stay with great value for the price.  Fantastic location near many stores, restaurants and a big entertainment/recreation center.  Check out the Taste of India Restaurant right down the street for a fast extra tasty bite.

Last minute business trip and picked this hotel because of my great experiences with Days Inn. I can say that I was the worst experience I ever had and not really happy about it. The room rate was overpriced, the quality of the room is dated and has really bad wear and tear. Some issues need to be addressed to keep up with the services and quality provided by other Days Inn hotels were I have stayed.  When checkin in, requested if I could please get my corporate rate ( I think her name was Amanda) and she stated that she could not honor it because I had to call Wyndham to arrange that and that they wouldn't do that while checkin. I knew this is false as I have given my corporate number in other hotels and they have honored it with no problem. I asked if I could use my Wyndham

I had no problems with the hotel, staff was nice, room was clean. WiFi was TERRIBLE. Could only get service if you were at the very head of the bed, and even still it took at least 3 minutes to load e-mail. Was able to get better service sitting on the couch of the other area of my room, (room was suite style with a separate closed off bedroom), but even that was slow, and was easier and less stressful to just not use. Pillows weren't great, but it's a hotel after all. Weird thing was one pillow case had the logo for a hospital a few hours away.

We ran the Surf City marathon and we got back a little later than we hoped from it. The staff was super understanding and let us check out slightly later than their usual time. This gave us time to shower and then check out. It was very nice of them and we appreciated it more than they will ever know.

First... The a/c didn't work. The lights in the bathroom would go off for a few mins and then come back on. The hair dryer plug was broke with exposed wiring and I think that's what kept the lights going on and off. Hard to sleep at night bc of the interstate ur 15 ft away from it. And the walls are paper thin. You hear every word InThe next room. One morning I was locked out bc my door ran out of battery. They had to take the door apart so I could get back in and to change the battery. The last day I stayed the toilet just stopped working...once that happened I checked out 20 mins later and stayed in a different hotel for the remainder of my stay. The tv had about 7 channels and 3 were like snow. I would never stay there again. If they charged $10.00 a night I would at lease

Summary Heading: Although a budget hotel, this property has invested wisely...
Summary: Although a budget hotel, this property has invested wisely in certain upgrades.  As it backs up to a busy freeway, the triple paned windows are greatly appreciated.  Pleasant staff, clean, and good quick breakfast.

So. I was looking for a inexpensive place to stay a few nights while in town. Just so happened I stayed valentine's weekend so it wasn't as inexpensive as I had expected. To be honest I probably could have stayed at a another hotel for the same rates.   Anywho... A few things noteworthy from my stay. One thing I noted is that the parking lot looks like it survived a massive earthquake. It's due to be repaved and probably could be leveled a lot more evenly.  I arrived late in the evening. The font desk was super nice, greeted me with a smile and got me in my room really fast.   The place itself is decent. It's a little dated. You have to really force the door open and they don't close all the way (at least mine didn't) I think the rest are the same because I heard people slamming

The desk service and maid service was excellent, however, the location of the hotel right beside 10 lanes of a freeway means constant traffic noise throughout the day and night.  The rooms were very clean but the bathroom was showing signs of black mold in the bathtub which was concerning as we have allergies to mold in our family.  It would have been nice to have larger pillows or more of them in our room - we found them quite tiny!  The lighting in the room was good but the auto-turn on of the hall light when someone snuck to the washroom was a bit annoying - it would have been nice to put this on a dimmer!  The continental breakfast consisted mostly of pastry/bread/waffle items and one fruit selection - it would have been nice to see a bit more fruit offered and perhaps a

Hotel looks very old..Room was small and no wash tub outside of rest room. Break fast is just with some cerials and few breads. So not satisfied with the stay. I tried to get a microwave cup, they said no first and late when we called from the room, they gave it.

The bed was terrible. It sunk in middle and I woke up with a back ache. House keeping never came in to clean the room. The ashtrays outside the room were overflowing. I think that if these thing are taken care of in the future, it can be a more pleasant stay.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Edward V.,  I am so sorry for your experience, and so embarrassed.	 We always try our best to make sure that all guests are happy with the stay at our hotel and I will make sure to share all your issues with all employees at the hotel. Please accept our deepest apology.  Thank you so much.

Summary Heading: Room had paraphernalia left in it from previous renters...
Summary: Room had paraphernalia left in it from previous renters.  Which leads me to believe the room was not cleaned.  The only good thing about our stay was the helpfulness of Amy at the front office.  She was very friendly.  Would not repeat a visit to this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. David L.  I am so sorry, and thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to inform us of your stay. I was happy to see that Amy was very helpful. I will bring your comments to all the staff. We have never had such issue and will do the best to not have it in the future.  Please accept my deepest apology.  Thank you.  Lee

Summary: This hotel is budget accommodation & provides just exactly what you would expect.  The check in process was easy & the manager was polite & attentive.  The room was clean & tidy & was like a "mini suite", king bed in the bed room & separated by a door, a living area with fridge/microwave & coffee maker.  Hairdryer in the bathroom.  The pillows are tiny but our request for more was fulfilled promptly with no problems. Situated adjacent to the freeway can be viewed 2 ways.  Access to the I-405 is very easy, however the traffic noise was loud.  Really loud.  We did not mind but it could be very bothersome if you are expecting a quite nights sleep.  Located within walking distance are several dining options & Starbucks. This property is adjacent to "Boomers" a kind of "mini

Overall: it was close to attractions (Boomers) and food, all in walking distance. Our lock on our room didnt lock- 1 strike Our fold out couch came with no blankets or sheets when I asked the attendant he told me that it was a futon and didnt come with sheets or blankets. The night manager hearing our conversation quickly jumped in and brought me supplies for my fold out bed- 2nd strike Overall staff was pleasant-- would give this hotel another try

The room smelled like the cheapest air freshner ever made and it was strong. I had to leave the windows open just to air it out. The room was $70 but felt more like a $35 room. The window in the bedroom only had a screen and was maybe 2 1/2 feet off the ground. If I had a young child I would not stay here; at least not on the 3rd floor.
The management and front desk staff should be commented for their friendly and promptly services for their guesses

Needed a inexpensive hotel in close proximity to friends. Located right off the freeway and in walking distant to several stores. The outside appearance has more of a motel feel and the colors aren't bright. The room i stayed in had an old tube tv, pictures missing on the wall. The towels went luxury and barely dried me off. Only 1 bar of soap on the sink no conidtioner, lotion or mouthwash you typically expect to see. AC blew right into the curtains which was a bit distracting as it could be confused with someone trying to come in (not hard to imagine given the location.) The 405 traffic noise wasn't to bad , it was outdid by the screaming kids who decided to use the pool area in the morning located just outside the door.

I recently stayed at this hotel for two nights with my spouse. It was an awesome place. We were just trying to get a cheap hotel near Huntington Beach, but it turned out much nicer than we expected. We were only planning on staying one night but ended up staying another night because it was so nice for the affordable price. The bedroom was separate from the main room and bathroom. Both rooms had tvs, and they also had a microwave and refrigerator. They also had a small pool and jacuzzi, which we used. Plus, the hotel was just a 15-minute drive from the main beach area and within walking distance of a Starbucks. The staff was also very friendly and helpful with any questions we had.

The room was great and staff was very friendly and helpful.  Continental breakfast was included which very reasonable.  Surprisingly there was not much of traffic noise as what I had read from the reviews.  We really enjoyed our staying and will have no hesitance to stay again.  Will recommend to friends and family.

The room was more than adequate.  The bed was not very comfortable.  Pillows way too hard.  Never could get the internet to work.  Called twice (different days) and both times told they would reboot the router, but never worked.

We wanted to see the cruise of lights in Huntington Beach harbor and figured we could never find a room for less than $200. This place was 8 miles from where the shuttle picked us up, an easy, straight shot. The room was very different.  2 rooms, 2 tvs, a couch, desk and chair and bed with tv in other room, very comfortable. Very clean. Nice turn out for breakfast, waffles .. etc. There is a burger joint on the corner which was great and a favorite with the locals...good burgers and fries, nice people. I would use this one again, any time!

Summary Heading: The room was clean and the colors of the redo very...
Summary: The room was clean and the colors of the redo very pleasant. The manager was especially courteous and helpful and gave us one of the more quiet rooms.  The breakfast was limited. Yogurt and hard boiled eggs would be nice as well as fresh fruit, like bananas. The location for our family was ideal and we will stay again if we can get a similar room. Oh, the beds make a loud noise when you turn over in them, probably need new box for mattress.

Spacious room, with a comfy bed, good sized flat-screen TV, microwave, fridge, etc. Amazed that despite being 60 feet from the 405 freeway, the windows kept out almost all the noise, and was not a problem for sleeping.

We found the accommodations clean and in a nice neighborhood.  Unfortunately, the heater was very loud, preventing good sleep.  Also, the toilet regurgitated waste after several hours.  Although breakfast was complimentary, it was the worst selection -- ZERO protein!  The staff was pleasant.
Really nice stay except. One morning at 4am, when a man and woman woke us up, drunk fighting and yelling two doors down.

Summary Heading: Very satisfied with my stay. Hotel staff were very friendly...
Summary: Very satisfied with my stay. Hotel staff were very friendly and hospitable. would definitely stay again. thank you for such great service!

Summary Heading: The building is not the same as pictured. The light inside...
Summary: The building is not the same as pictured. The light inside the room did not work. Two electric plugs were cracked. The bed was suppose to be a King size, it was a Double. Because of these problems, my wife & I believe we should receive a rebate for a hotel that was not the same as what you have on the internet. Television in the bedroom had less visual channels than the television in the living room area. The couch in the living room area was not real comfortable.   The hot water in the bathroom sink was very slow to get hot, even warm.  For breakfast, there was nothing my wife or I could have except orange juice and coffee. I am gluten & wheat free and my wife is diabetic.
I was pleasantly surprised with comfort of this hotel. Rooms were clean and spacious and very comfortable. I would definitely stay there again

it was my birthday trip with my wife.we love the area the hotel is in! the price was very reasonable! the hotel and the room was very clean.the staff was friendly.the plus for us was the comfortable bed, having a microwave,coffeemaker and fridge in the room.also the free breakfast! there are plenty of restaurants near the hotel, some walkable.cvs is just across the street.the only bad thing is the freeway is right behind the hotel and gets a bit noisey during rush hour! when we turned the tv and air conditioner on we didn`t notice it too much.

The property is in need of a major rehab. The rooms were awful. The kid at the front desk at check in was not a model of good customer service. The web site indicated an exercise room but one didn't exist. The room was arranged horribly...the list goes on. If a breakfast was included, I would not have eaten it.

If you are looking for a simple hotel in a safe area than this is the place for you. It is right next to the freeway so if cars both you then you need a room away from the freeway or turn the AC on. It does have a fan mode. Everyone is very friendly, even the maids. There is nowhere that is walking distance to eat besides chili burgers. Internet is slow here and the tv gets rabbit ears channels and 3 HBOs. Breakfast is pretty good.

I have been only one day/night there, but it was good service and breakfast for that price what I have paid. WiFi was really slow, but working. If I have a chance to come back and stay again in this hotel - I will do it.

I have stayed here twice. First time was with my mom & little brother, second time was with my then-bf, now husband. Everyone was happy.  Price was right! location was good, it is right off the 405 freeway that give you easy access to every where you want to go, however there is some noise, but we didnt have any problem with getting to sleep, everyone slept like a baby. Exterior of the hotel & the room was clean, although inside was a bit dated, but I could see the housekeepers tried their best to keep the room/place tidy. There was one time I went out early in the morning and came back in the afternoon to rest, I saw the housekeepers vacuum & cleaned the place really carefully. They smiled and said hi to everyone. every room comes with free wifi & breakfast, waffle was hot &

Summary Heading: The breakfast was good, but it was the same thing...
Summary: The breakfast was good, but it was the same thing repeatedly. I stayed there 3 days so it was a bit tiring to be eating the same thing for each morning.

we read the reviews of others and they were not all that good. but we decided to see for ourselves. glad we did. very nice stay. rooms were clean. pool was small but nice. and the staff was great so we will come back again...

Service = great.  The cleaning staff was very thorough and kept our room smelling nice and fresh!  Front desk staff was awesome too.  So friendly.  Felt like home.  The manager is wonderful.  I had issues when booking online and I called and he helped me a great deal!   We were delayed due to our car rental.  When we arrived at the hotel, it was about 2am and I was travelling with a toddler.  Needless to say, the front desk staff helped me so quickly and it was so easy.   Value and location is excellent.  The rates are reasonable if you are travelling on a budget (aka = me)  The location is awesome too.  Close to the 405 exit and also to Huntington Beach, if you're a beach lover.  The hotel felt like home.  I traveled with my 3 year old daughter and felt safe.  It was a little

When I booked this hotel it came up as a pet friendly hotel but was told after a nites stay that they were not and we were told to leave. I tried to get to your customer service and get a refund but was unsucessful.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Ronald B., Thank you so much for your review on our property. I am so sorry about your misunderstanding with the reservation company about our pet policy, but when we have looked together on the website, our finding was consistent with our pet policy. And I apologize about your decision to leave our property despite my invitation to stay the remaining night. I do apologize for any inconvenience.

Summary: Yes my stay was just average. When I checked in they told me that the computer system was down and I had to wait. Also they advised me that it was $100.00 deposit because I was using a Debt Card I asked why so much and was told it was a common amount. I explained that I travel for business and the most I have ever had to deposit was $50.00 per night also I asked why is the deposit more than what I was paying for 1 nite. He did not have an answer for me. The room was clean but the bed was very uncomfortable, their is only 1 A/C unit and its in the bedroom so the other part of the room does not get cold.

The bed was very comfortable but the location, noise, lack of air flow due to drapes hanging over flow vent were terrible.  I would never stay at this location again.  I had to wear ear plugs due to so much noise from traffic on freeway. The tv had minimal channels, awful selection of what was available.

Location of the hotel was very nice and private.The  staff there were super nice and very helpful.The rooms were the average nice n cozy!.I like that there were amenities close by,so we could easily get around to drug store,.grocery,and bakery.. We would definitely come back to stay!

Well the internet did not work, the air conditioning did not work and the floors were sopping wet from cleaning the carpets that day. Lee the manager did not care at all when notified of this and did nothing to help. He was more attentive to all of the Chinese people who had come that night and stated such. They were all noisy running around and we couldn't sleep

Surprised that we were able to sleep - room next to freeway; young guys hanging out talking about just getting busted by cops.. Didn't feel too safe. Front desk staff were very courteous & helpful.  Room needed thorough cleaning - used tampon was left in ice bucket GROSS! Breakfast choices were severely lacking. Think we overpaid..
Room did not smell good. Old and outdated. Questioned the cleanliness of the couch and flooring.  Loud freeway noise.Way overpriced!  1 star at best.
Overall, room had enough space.  Air conditioning really did not work too well though.  Location is good for hopping on the freeway.  Beds and pillows were not very comfortable.
location good, exterior needs work, pool not inviting, close to food, etc. close to highway /traffic hard to get good night sleep , AC noisy.

When we drove up to the hotel first thing we found was that there was no adequate parking.  Their parking lot was full and we had to park across the street at a skating rink.  I felt uncomfortable leaving my car.  The door to our room was cracked and the property was not very nice, it is old.  The rooms were decent, the bathroom was clean.  The pillows were not very comfortable so if you are traveling to this property bring your own.  If you only need a place to sleep, I guess this is ok.

For $118 a night it was no better than a Motel 6(but Motel 6 has cleaner updated rooms). The charged a $100.00 deposit on top of the $118.00 a night fee. They 2 rooms above be was a group party, saw then lugging up coolers, and had to listen to the noise all night. The handicapped shower was broken. Was not a roll in shower. Next time if this is the only room in Orange County I'll go sleep on the beach.
Wonderful service. Great management.  Always ready to help. Return customer. Previously stayed here one year ago.

Summary Heading: What a great property w/Friendly staff!
Summary: We had a great time with friends and family at this property. We were in from out-of-town (Chicagoland) for a wedding and spent the weekend here. The rooms were as expected, but the staff was Great.

My wife and I come to Huntington Beach every 3rd year. This is the second time we've stayed here. The staff is friendly, you can't beat the prices, and it's in a great location... close to the freeway and food. General Manager Byung Lee was especially nice and professional. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed 4 nights 4th of July weekend. Best time ever; the room was very nice with a refrigerator and microwave. The location of hotel is on quiet street, its close to freeways, close to beaches, and many shops, gas stations and places to eat are close by. The hotel manager and staff were all very friendly and attentive to our needs. Breakfast in the morning was wonderful,and the pool and spa clean and very refreshing. We will stay here again and would recommend it to our friends/family,

I came to fountain valley because my granddaughter was having surgery. I picked Days Inn because it was freeway close to the hospital. the staff is friendly and made me feel comfortable. the rooms are clean and  there is a patio a pool and a spa. I could have chosen a cheaper hotel but that was not my focus for this trip. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a safe clean place to stay.
Manager Response: Good morning, Gail M.,  We certainly appreciate that you took the time to leave us such a pleasant review. We're also very glad to hear that you found our rooms, staff, and amenities comfortable and that the location convenient to your needs.  Thank you again for taking the time to leave a review with us!  Sincerely,  Days Inn and Suites of Fountain Valley & Huntington Beach

Summary: Although the room we had looked NOTHING like the picture at the on line site, it was clean, beds were comfortable and everything worked. The TV was a tube tv that did frequently go to snow but even that worked ok. This location was good with places to eat and entertainment next door. It is located right off the 405 so easy access to other places was available.
Manager Response: Good morning, Randal S.,  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, especially that you found the rooms and beds comfortable. It's wonderful that you enjoyed our convenient location and the entertainment within very close distance of our location.  Thank you very much for leaving a review with us, and we hope to see you in the future!  Sincerely,  Days Inn and Suites of Fountain Valley & Huntington Beach

Summary: The rooms are all right by the highway and its extremely loud. I was told by your staff that they would relocate me and to check in the office first thing in the morning 3 days in a row and each time I was told you were all booked up, I called to make a reservation over the phone and was told you had rooms? I dont appreciate being lied to!
Manager Response: Dear Steven P.,   Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review for us!  We're very sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy your stay as much as you would have liked, and we always make every effort to attend to every one of our guests' needs. While we do take requests for placement in requested areas of the hotel, unfortunately we are not always able to accommodate said requests.  We apologize that you were unhappy with your stay, and we hope we are better able to accommodate you if you if you give us the opportunity in the future.   Sincerely,  Days Inn and Suites of Fountain Valley & Huntington Beach

Summary Heading: The motel was ok, decent location, not to loud, good...
Summary: The motel was ok, decent location, not to loud, good breakfast... However, the bed was pretty old- no support.  The pool was closed for 2 days due to 'an incident' (the front desk said). Had we known that, we would have stayed elsewhere as we like to relax at the pool.
Manager Response: Dear Avery V.,  Thank you for leaving a review with us!   We apologize that you did not find the beds as comfortable as you would have liked, and we also apologize for the inconvenience of the pool being closed. We always do our best to give our guests fair warning when our pool will be down for maintenance. All things considered, it sounds like you enjoyed your stay, and we certainly hope to see you again in the future!  Sincerely,  Days Inn and Suites of Fountain Valley & Huntington Beach

Summary: This was the worst hotel. Don't stay here. The towels were threadbare, the "breakfast" was cold cereal and white bread. Oh ya...the 405 freeway is right there outside your window. Very noisy. I would say go spend $10 more for something else. They give you 2 pillows for a king size bed, so we asked for another. Guess what? They said they didn't have any more. OK...just DON'T spend your hard earned dollars at this dump.
very nice at front desk, good price.  liked they had a pool attendant.  allowed us to enjoy ourselves @ pool.  room was clean.  bathroom floor was slippery. a/c was very loud in room.
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca M.,  Thank you for leaving a review with us! We're very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to enjoy the pool. We are sorry to hear that the noise from the air conditioner was uncomfortable, but we are glad to hear that you were satisfied by the rest of your stay.  We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Days Inn and Suites of Fountain Valley & Huntington Beach

Summary: Good location. Entrance is difficult to find the first time as it is not directly on the main road. Good continental breakfast. Rooms on the second and third floors that are next to the I-405 are noisy. Best price I could find for the area that I wanted to be near. This is formerly a Ramada Inn and is dated but the rooms appear to have been refurbished. Appears to have lots of bookings with foreign tour groups so the small car park should be of no issue for space. Car park could use a resurfacing.

We had a spacious, clean and fine room on the third floor. Very friendly reception and hotel manager. We stayed for 9 nights.  The hotel is conveniently located in Fountain Valley at the I-405 and perfect for most destinations in Orange County like Huntington Beach, and Southern LA County.  Good value for a great stay.
Manager Response: Good afternoon, Steffen,  Thank you so much for taking the time to place such a kind and detailed review of our property. We appreciate your comments! We are also pleased that you enjoyed your 9-night stay and certainly hope to see you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Days Inn and Suites of Fountain Valley and Huntington Beach

Summary Heading: Property is dated - formerly a Ramada Inn. Rooms appear to...
Summary: Property is dated - formerly a Ramada Inn. Rooms appear to be recently refurbished. Lots of freeway noise.

Service was fine-front desk check-in person was courteous and friendly. Room was cold, dingy and had a terrible odor. Had to open the windows first thing when we step inside! Noise from freeway traffic could be heard even when the windows were closed. Will check first if hotel is near freeway before choosing to book with them.

Summary Heading: Good breakfast and the hotel room spa works.
Summary: Even though we were right next to the 405 Freeway the room was quiet. We loved the indoor spa.  The only thing I wish was different was that the pool was locked at 9:30 AM. If we had know we couldn't jump in the pool before leaving we may have stayed elsewhere.
Manager Response: Good afternoon, Michael,  We are certainly pleased that you enjoyed your stay at our property and that you found the indoor Jacuzzi tub enjoyable.   The pool hours are from 10:00 AM until 10:00 PM, however we do apologize that you were not able to enjoy the pool prior to your departure.   Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review, and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Days Inn and Suites of Fountain Valley and Huntington Beach

Summary Heading: Great location. Walking distance to a Starbucks...
Summary: Great location. Walking distance to a Starbucks, rollerskate ring, Boomers & American food restaurants that have full bars!
Manager Response: Good afternoon Rosalie,  We are happy that you found our property enjoyable, as well as the convenient central location to places such as Boomers, the skating rink, and the various restaurants in the area.   Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review!  Sincerely,  Days Inn and Suites of Fountain Valley and Huntington Beach

Summary: While the location is great, the room was abundant and price was affordable, what's the point of staying somewhere if sleep is not guarantee. Even putting on the loud in room fan, I looked out the window and saw/heard the 405 just like you would look out your window and see your street. All it takes is a motorcycle zooming by to throw everything off.

This hotel served its purpose, but I felt it was a little overpriced for what it actually was. It's not upscale, but it's good enough and does the job. Very close to freeway access, see it from your room, but handy if you're on a business trip. I felt it was overpriced for the quality. Staff was very nice.

Summary Heading: Before I booked this motel, he night before we stayed in...
Summary: Before I booked this motel, he night before we stayed in it, I called to ask if their pool was heated and open.  I was told yes, it's heated and is open. When we got their the next day, the pool was closed for maintenance.  Disappointing for my kids.  We stayed 3 days and the pool was NEVER warm.  I finally asked why they don't heat it and was told it's not heated.  We asked to change rooms since the room it literally 5 feet from the 405 freeway, but none were available...hence did not sleep well at all!
Toilet did not flush right and took forever to fill. My wife had a back ache everyday from the bad bed.

When I first saw the motel located right up against the 405 freeway, I had bad thoughts about the sound, thousands of cars going by, etc.  They must have great sound-proofing because everything was "A-ok," and I slept like a baby.  Staff was efficient and friendly.

Summary Heading: good room, really good price. liked whoever checked us in...
Summary: good room, really good price. liked whoever checked us in, nice and professional needed more parking and had to go to the 3rd floor to get ice, we were on the bottom. great breakfast

I was down for Business and I had a long day went into Fresh and Easy got dinner and wine...Went back to hotel and realized I had nothing to eat with..I went downstairs and the guy at the front was very nice and gave me plenty of silverware. It was just pleasant knowing they had little things like that handy and after a stressful day its nice to have a good staff thats helpful. Thanks!

The general manager Mr.Lee is AWESOME I've stayed at this hotel several times in the last few months and every time I stay he is helpful and courteous . Earlier this month I stayed at this hotel for an event across the street and there was a situation with a person in the room next to us Mr.lee made a point to come upsnd see if we needed snything and apologize which he didn't have to do ...... I be already book my next night there in March for my Birthday.

Very convenient location to where I needed to be. Nothing fancy, but very practical, clean, safe, friendly staff, adequate space in the rooms for 2 adults, loved the frig, coffee maker, free safe, free breakfast, free WiFi, although it sometimes got dropped, and big screen TV.  Since there were two of us traveling togeher, we couldn't get a room with the walk-in shower because it only had one bed. At least the tub was lower than usual, but there were no safety bars on the sides of the wall, just along the inside wall of the tub.  The hotel industry needs to realize that the disabled person or those who need a walk in shower most likely would not want to share the one bed with their attendant and having the attendant in a separate room defeats the purpose of having an attendant.

Summary Heading: Days Inn Comfort @ a Reasonable Cost
Summary: Days Inn provides a comfortable and pleasant experience at a reasonable price.  Their staff is trained and customer friendly.  I have chosen to stay at DI many times and expect the same kind of experience in the future.   Continued upgrade of facilities coupled with customer friendly policies will ensure future success and increased market share.   Suggest a toast to a bright and profitable future!

I was in a handicapped room, the bed was WONDERFUL the bathroom was great, and manager Lee and his staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.  Great value for the money !! I look forward to my next stay  .

We have usually always chose Days Inn for Quality; However this Days Inn should be AVOIDED!! We chose this Days as it was close the highway to get to the beach and from the airport.  We were so upset that the WiFi was the MOST Horrible WIFI EVER! We had to use the pool login and not the hotel over and over and switch back and forth. They have to advertise that they restrict customer use on their site which was always less than 2 bars. When I called they told us that they restrict all movies, music and entertainment. We wanted to Skype with our family on New Years Eve and were unable to which was so disappointing for us all. We also wanted to see a post of a family member on you tube and were denied. WE NEVER would have chose this hotel knowing that they controlled our internet.

We were in town for a soccer tournament, and our entire team stayed here. The beds were really comfortable, the rooms were large, and the free breakfast (including waffles) was great. It is conveniently located next to a mini-golf place, as well as the freeway, and other restaurants. The staff was super friendly and helpful. My only complaint was that we had a window overlooking the freeway and that made it quite noisy at night.

Summary Heading: Noisy due to proximity to 405 Freeway
Summary: This is the most noisy hotel I ever stayed in.  I spent two nights there, and could not wait to check out due to the noisiness of the place. For one, it is close to the 405 Freeway (approximately 15 feet from the freeway). Secondly, due to lack of high speed wireless. Third, the room was not as clean as I would have expected, especially the bed. I felt ichy the whole time I was there, though I have to admit the room was spacious.  The front desk ladies were pretty helpful. Parking was free!

Summary Heading: Priced perfectly. Fantastic and helpful Staff !!
Summary: Its not the Ritz or Four Seasons or Grand Hyatt. Great location and if your on a budget, the perfect place. Semi dated but still, everything was great. I would definitely return and stay again. Book early to get the best deals.

Need to take a look at property we own in the immediate area.  The location of this hotel is perfect for our infrequent visits - only a mile away from the property - and ideally located such that we don't even need to take the car out for such things as restaurants or other shopping.

Decent room with King-size bed. Hotel was supposed to come with high-speed wireless internet access but I could not connect to the wifi at all, despite trying all three different accounts which the front desk provided. Told the front desk staff but issue was not resolved.  The front desk staff on duty changes daily and each time only one person is around. Front desk staff, by the name of Amanda, was much more helpful. She was on duty on the day I arrived. The staff on other days were less than helpful.   Housekeeping did not provide new paper cups/teabags/coffee. When I went down on second night of my stay to ask for cups, teabags, the front desk staff was unable to provide until I insist on the need to have tea before I sleep.
Just required a cheap and clean motel for one night as I was traveling solo, this place was neat and tidy, rooms were spacious and clean, and in a quiet neighborhood.

Our home was being fumigated and we had to move out for two nights.  Our HOA got the residents a deal with this Days Inn.  It was fine for two nights.  Room was stuffy the first night, but 2nd night we were more comfortable.   Nothing fancy regarding breakfast, but sufficient food.  Staff we met were friendly and helpful, we wanted some extra towels and got them immediately.  We actually called the hotel a day or so in advance to request a ground floor room and they told us then that it was confirmed.  Freeway noise didn't keep either of us from sleeping.   We would recommend this as a comfortable place to stay.

Our stay was good. Only problem: Too close to noisey freeway and neighbors were noisey at 3 AM ! Everything else was good. Need bananas for breakfast ! Too many furnishings for a handicapped room. Lights need "regular" switches, not the kind that are installed at this time.

Exterior of motel is good n inside the room also good but the bed sheets have some marks.they are not even changed once in my 4 nights stay. wifi is so bad,i tried to connect to wifi,but in 4days,its not connected once also. went to front desk and used the desktop over there in lobby. they don have printer for guests. 1st day they gave complimentary toothbrush with dried toothpaste on the brush already,but on 2nd they told me to  pay $1 for one toothbrush,it was so bad.

As a family, we decided to spend a weekend at Huntington Beach and wanted the convenience of close access to the beach without paying an arm and a leg. We have also stayed in Days Inn in the past and love the staff, the quality of the rooms, breakfast etc. but this was very disappointing.  1) When I reserved the room, I asked for 2 queen beds. When we got there, they said they I had requested 2 doubles. 2)	The walls were scratched and had holes. We couldn't even sit at the table as the table and chairs were on the verge of breaking.  3)	We noticed that the primary wifi signal was not working. When I brought this to their attention the first night, I was told to use the backup (poolside) and they would report it to their manager and IT Staff. The secondary signal dropped every 15
Back up to 405 Freeway and very noisy.  Room was hot and air only came on as a "motion detector".  Bed was lumpy and uncomfortable along with the foam tiny pillows they provide.

We were very satisfied with our stay at the Days Inn Fountain Valley CA. The staff was super friendly, the bed was comfortable and the hot tub was perfect! Perfect price for our budget too! The hotel is right off the 405 freeway so there is some noise, but turn on the Air Conditioner/Fan or the TV and that takes care of that :) We are planning to take another trip there and we will be staying here again!

We stayed here for 4 nights.  Was close enough to the beach.  About 10 minutes to Hunington Beach Pier.  Room was clean, a little outdated, but clean.  Breakfast was great.  Waffles, bagels, toast, oatmeal, and a few other items.  That saved us money and was a plus.  The staff were extemely freindly and accomodating.  Let us check in early and accomodated our request for ground floor.  Great value for the money, good location, close to the I-405.  I would recommend this hotel.  Will be staying there again if we are ever in that area again.

My family stayed at this hotel in August and I have to say I am very disappointed.  My family had 3 rooms for a week.  We were told our rooms were going to be next to each other, which didn't happen.  We were missing a coffee machine, our bathroom mirror was full of black dots and scratches and our air conditioner barely worked.  My parents room had a terrible bed.  My sister's room didn't have a working tub.  Yet, I bring this up to the manager and he acted like he couldn't do anything.  The breakfast attendant is also in housekeeping.  I watched her touch dirty laundry then walk in to the breakfast room and touch the food without washing her hands. I couldn't eat there the rest of the week.  The topper of this whole experience was when my husband's new clothes were taken from
Manager Response: Dear Mrs. Amanda C.  I apologize for the experience you had staying at our hotel. We do our best to make your stay as comfortable as possible.  When making a reservation, the front desk member try to assign family reservations as close as possible, and try to fulfill any preferences as to room location. We cannot always guarantee that the rooms will be adjacent, and that is sometimes not possible due to the occupancy at the hotel and the guest's specified room type.  We do our best to get the rooms as close as possible.  Upon being informed of the coffee machine, the front desk had a new one brought to the room promptly. The front desk was not informed of any other problems regarding the quality of the bed or the working tub. Our maintenance man is on duty at all times, and if we had been informed of this, we would do our best to fix the accommodations according to your needs.   The breakfast room opens at six in the morning, before the housekeepers begin the laundry at 9 am. The breakfast attendant would not have come into contact with any laundry prior to opening the breakfast room or during breakfast hours.   The front desk clerk was informed of the missing clothing article. It was a blue shirt placed in a plastic bag, which was tied up and left near the trash receptacle on the floor. The item was, most likely, mistaken for trash due to its placement in the room, and we apologize.  I am very sorry that I was not consistently at the property due to sudden death of my mother.   The Days Inn staff nor I would ever lie about a tragic, horrible event. And please, again, accept my apology for not being able to fulfill my duty because of death of my mother.  We deeply apologize for the quality of your stay. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Clean, Good value for money and conveniently located
Summary: We stayed 3  nights at the hotel along with a larger wedding party. The room and the bathroom were clean. Housekeeping staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast which was included with the room was very good with a variety of stuff which the kids loved. Apart from the noise due to the proximity of a major highway, there were no complaints. Would highly recommend it to anyone.

Looking for an overnite stay after roaming in the orange county. We were unable to find this recreation circle in the night its a small road, we went round and round finally we could spot this after 2 rounds. After finding the hotel it was decent and nice. Breakfast was quite good and had a comfortable stay here.

The location of this hotel is really quite good. The rooms were clean and the staff are friendly, helpful, and courteous. The free breakfast is good and plentiful. Have stayed in the Hilton, the Holiday Inn, and many other upscale hotels on past visits, and this is the best for the money. The beds  are just right, which provided a good nights sleep. And the bonus is that the rooms are quiet. Will continue to stay at this hotel when in southern California. Additionally, the manager is very professional and accommodating.

This hotel is a cheap alternative to many of the high priced ones in the area.  It's not fancy, and as noted by others, it backs up to a view of the lovely 405 freeway, but the noise was not bothersome to us.  We spent 2 nights here on a vacation to Disneyland, and chose it because it was low cost (we spent most of our time at Disneyland anyway), and was within a few miles of Huntington Beach.  Nothing special, but overall a good value.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to write the review of your stay at Days Inn and Suite. Everyone at Days Inn and Suite strive to make all guests experience to be as pleasant as possible, and with your comments we will work even harder to make sure your next visit to our property will be even better then before. With our deepest gratitude, Thank you very much for giving Days Inn and Suite the opportunity to serve your lodging needs and hope to provide your future stay with better service.  BK Lee, G.M.

Summary Heading: Friendly, Clean but some false advertising
Summary: The price was great! room was clean and staff was friendly, the free breakfast is good. The freeway traffic was not that bothersome with the fan running, I slept really good which I usually don't away from home, however their website says check out is noon and when you get to the hotel it is 11am and they advertise that you will not be charged until check out, which is not true, I was charged upon check in. Overall experience was good, I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear SM, Thank you so much for taking time out of your busy schedule to write this review. All reviews are taken very seriously and help us to improve our service to all guests. I deeply apologize for not being able to fulfill your highest expectation at our hotel. I will update the correct the checkout time. Again, please accept my deepest apology for and for any inconvenience. We will do our best to make your next visit as pleasant as possible.

Summary: Hotel was very clean and nice.  staff was very friendly.  i can not believe this hotel was most nicest place in earth.  I will defenitly recommand all my friends when they are going to L.A

Im staying here for one night, the room is comfortable, hot breakfast availble until 9am, I wish they would extended until 10 to give some more sleep in time but otherwise is good for the price I paid
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the opportunity to serve your lodging need at Days Inn and Suite. I am very happy that your experience with us was comfortable and good but can get better with longer breakfast hours.  Every guest's request is taken very seriously and will try to make the change. Again thank your for lodging at Days Inn and Suite and for the review. No matter how hard we try our best to make every guest stay feel more comfortable, there is always a room for improvement and your review will help us deliver better service to our next guest. Thank you.

Summary: The hotel is freshly painted. The room, bathroom and rugs were nice and clean. The bed was VERY comfortable. We had a whirlpool tub in the bathroom. There was a hassle-free wifi signal in the room. The free breakfast was excellent, with good coffee and wonderful waffles that you make yourself. There was also a wide selection of cereals and baked goods. My experience in this hotel was very good.
Manager Response: Happy New Year, and best wishes and fortune for 2012. Thank you for sharing your experience of our hotel. It has always been our main goal to give the best experience to all of our guests. No details are too small or too large. We have and always will do our best for the guests. With ongoing upgrades to all the rooms, I hope to make your next visit even better........ Thank you again, and hope to see you again soon.  BK Lee, G.M.

Summary: As a frequent traveler (Business and pleasure), I've stayed in every type of hotel across the country. I was very pleasantly surprised at the amenities (lobby computer was great for me and the free coffee was a nice plus) but really surprised at the level of service. For the amount of money they charge, the hotel provides a level of courtesy, professionalism, and friendliness that are usually found at hotels that charge twice this rate.  It was very close to the beach and various attractions and had easy access to the interstate.  Honestly they should probably be charging more for the type of hotel they run. Kids also had a blast at the adjacent minigolf/family arcade.
Manager Response: Live2travel, Thank you so much for your review. I am so glad to see that you had a great stay at the Days Inn and Suite. And the staff provided the level of service above the expectation. I have always encouraged the staff to give service as you would like to be serviced.  In today’s economy, I know how hard it is to find a good value for the dollar. But we, at Days Inn and Suite, strive to give the best value and service that is above the expectation by all guests. I was very happy to see that we have achieved our goal on your stay and will work even harder to do better on you next vacation.

Summary: i drove into the hotel real early, and i wasnt sure if my room was going to be ready due to the fact that i came in early and i had special requests for my room. i was greeted by the front desk clerk travis, he was very proffesional and helpful, my room was rushed and i was in my room within a matter of 15 minutes,  the area is great for various activities, there is a lot of restaurants, as well as a theme park next door, and right by the freeway so when i went to my business meetings i was able to jump right on the freeway, the room was real clean the breakfast was great and free, which is a huge bonus for me. i reccomend this hotel  to all people who like to be close to the beach without paying the ridiculous prices that hotels in that area charge.

The moment I walked in, I was greeted by the well lit lobby and the front desk worker. Checking in was very fast and no hassle at all, and the receptionist was very welcoming. I had a corner room, so the back window had the freeway behind it, but it was very muted, and even at night I couldn't hear it because I had the fan going. The room was very clean, and the bed was comfortable. I stayed several nights with some friends and we had no problem at all. The housekeeping and front desk did all they could to accomodate us - extra towels for the jacuzzi outside, fresh coffee, whatever. Free breakfast was pretty good - not "junk" in my opinion since it had waffles and cereal and everything FOR FREE. The area is excellent - plenty of things to do within walking distance if you don't

Summary Heading: Noisy Hotel with Poor Internet Service
Summary: Please take note: If you are a light sleeper, THIS HOTEL IS NOT FOR YOU!!  A majority of the rooms (probably 80%) of them back right up to the 405 Freeway (one of the biggest freeways in the LA area). All night I had trucks, cars and motorcycles speeding past my 3rd floor room (shaking the windows) and keeping me awake. The hotel was "full" so the front desk clerk (who was not very friendly by the way) said I could not be moved. The Internet service was also VERY slow (desk clerk told me it was because the hotel was full). Although the rooms were clean and the bedding new, this is an older property with a tiny pool and very few amenities. I will never stay here again.

Summary Heading: Okay, for a couple of days
Summary: The place is showing it's age but the room was clean and pretty large.  Our daughter got a room at the Comfort Inn and said our room was much larger than theirs.  The freeway noise is bad but you cannot sleep without the a/c on and it's drowns out the freeway noise.   It leaves you with sort of a "white noise" and we slept okay.    Breakfast is typical Days Inn junk but there is a good cafe across the street.  (Magnolia Cafe).   Good entertainment for the kids next door with roller skating and othe rides and attractions.  Internet is poor.  We were there for a family wedding and did not spend much time in the room.

Overwhelmed by computer in the lobby. There are only few provide this. Eversince I lost my lap top while traveling, I do not carry one anymore. One of the top Days Inn I ever been to and I do travel ALOT. I live off the suit case almost 1/2 of the year.  Staffs were very nice.  Close to highway meaning easy access. Little noisy but usually I sleep at night so didn't bother me much. And don't spend time during the day. Rooms were clean enough. Definitely worth the money.
